955311240637.summary: "I AM AN ARKTIVIST" is an innovative networking event for environmentalists, aimed at fostering environmental awareness and promoting a green lifestyle by connecting local residents, businesses, and organizations through creative and community-driven initiatives. Who Should Attend: Environmental Organizations : Showcase your services and impactful work. There are no fees to participate, and if you wish to donate towards our admin fee, it would help us reach out to corporations and businesses that will be invited to pick projects to support. Local Businesses : Learn about eco-friendly practices and discover how you can support existing environmental projects. Artists : Display eco-friendly artworks that promote messages of cutting waste and environmental preservation. Volunteers: Join us in raising awareness and supporting the event logistics. Community Members: Anyone passionate about the environment and interested in learning more about local environmental efforts and the I AM AN ARKTIVIST initiative. Benefits of Participating: Networking: Connect with like-minded individuals, organizations, and businesses committed to environmental sustainability. Exposure : Highlight your organization's work and services to a diverse audience, including potential supporters and collaborators. Education : Gain insights into innovative waste management practices and sustainability efforts within the community. Support : Help raise awareness about climate change and local environmental issues, contributing to a collective effort to create a greener future. Impact : Be part of a movement that fosters community cohesion, environmental education, and sustainable action. This event is supported by BD Giving through their Give It A Go funding award, selected from 55 proposals by a group of young residents, underscoring the significance and potential impact of this gathering. Calling all Local Organizations and Passionate Residents! Mark your calendars for November 30th and join us at Barking Learning Centre for "I Am An Arktivist" a unique event that brings together the community, creatives, and environmental advocates to take action for a greener future! At Laura I Art Gallery , we believe in the power of creativity for social change , and this event will be an inspiring showcase of art , performance , and collaboration aimed at protecting our planet. Heres what to expect: Incredible local talent art exhibitions featuring works made from upcycled materials. Powerful performances by poets, singers, and creatives inspiring environmental action. Presentations from environmental leaders sharing Barking and Dagenhams vision of becoming the Green Capital of the Capital. Meet Noah, our beloved planet mascot ! Young attendees will have the chance to meet Noah, share their stories about participating in litter-picking initiatives and other environmental efforts, and receive an Arktivist (Eco Warrior) badge as a token of recognition for their contributions. Opportunities to network with organizations and individuals making a real impact. This event is not just for organizations residents with a passion for the environment are invited too! Whether youre here to learn, connect, or take action, theres something for everyone. Save the date: November 30th, 11 AM - 3:30 PM Barking Learning Centre Lets come together, inspire each other, and build a more sustainable future. To Reserve Your Spot: Organizations: Please confirm your participation to secure a table for your display. Individuals : Book your ticket to join us at the event and learn more about the incredible work being done to preserve our environment, including our innovative project, Noahs Ark. We look forward to your participation and to making a significant impact together.
955311240637.description: Are you passionate about the environment? Would you like to join our innovative and creative network?
955311240637.event_address: Barking Learning Centre (Barking Library) 2 Town Square Barking Learning Centre, Barking IG11 7NB, Barking, IG11 7NB
955311240637.title: "I AM AN ARKTIVIST": Building Networks for Sustainable Change.

794737339777.summary: Let's speak French while walking in Hampstead Heath (This event is for French speakers, from beginner to native speakers) Hampstead Heath is one of the largest and most popular green spaces in the Greater London area. It is only 4 miles from central London but it feels like 4,000 miles from the bustle of the city. The Heath covers roughly 790 acres (about 360 hectares) and runs along a sandy ridge between Highgate to the east and Hampstead to the south-west. You can also buy drinks and food at Kenwood House. We will meet at a tube station and we will walk to the heath. We will go to Kenwood House and we will have a drink or a snack at Brew Caf. (You don't have to buy anything to sit with us at the caf). I dont encourage any late comer because the heath is huge. If you are late, just head to Kenwood House to meet us. Dress according to the weather: bring a warm jumper and a waterproof jacket during winter time. Wear walking shoes. The heath can be muddy. You are responsible for your own safety and for the safety of your belongings. I look forward to seeing you. The French Enthusiasts Team
794737339777.description: French conversation and walk in Hampstead Heath on Sunday 6th October 2024. We will walk to Kenwood House and go back to the station.
794737339777.title: French Conversation and Walk in Hampstead Heath

1034861096397.summary: Spiritually Curious Bedfordians Meetup October: Come and join us for a friendly discussion about all things spiritual. Spirituality is a diverse and broad topic that means different things to different people. Let's explore its meaning together as a collective. Meet and talk with other spiritually curious humans from Bedford, Bedfordshire and beyond. Everyone is welcome, from all backgrounds and beliefs. Feel free to come alone or bring a friend along to join the conversation. We'll be gathering on the cosy blue sofa at the Green Earth Caf for our monthly meetup. When: Wednesday, 23rd October, Time: 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm. Where: Green Earth Caf, 13 St Paul's Square, Bedford, Bedfordshire, MK40 1SL Sponsored by: Green Earth Caf, a vegan caf offering a range of vegan options, all locally sourced and locally made. They also have locally made arts, crafts, and deli goods for sale. Support the caf: This meetup event is completely FREE to attend. However, we kindly ask you to support the caf by purchasing refreshments and food. Disclaimer: Our goal is to create an open and inclusive space for discussion, where everyone can share their thoughts and experiences without judgment. Let's encourage active listening, empathy, and the exploration of different viewpoints to foster a meaningful conversation about spirituality as a collective. No Selling: Please honour the sanctity of our space by refraining from promoting goods or services during our time together. Follow us on: Instagram and Facebook Remember to: Add the Dates to your Calendar! Hashtags: #spirituality #spiritual #spiritualgrowth #spiritualjourney #spiritualawakening #religion #faith #belief #god #universe #lawofattraction #synchronicity #manifestation #gratitude #meetup #discussion #greenearthcafe #vegancafe #veganfood #bedford #bedfordshire #bedshour
1034861096397.description: Spiritually Curious Bedfordians Monthly Meetup Group. Meet and talk with other spiritually curious humans from Bedford and Bedfordshire.
1034861096397.title: Spiritually Curious Bedfordians Meetup October

1043538350297.summary: IF you are a MEMBER then please put your 2024 membership number (starts 24XXXX) into the PROMO CODE box above to get your discounted ticket Join us for our next CPD Breakfast, less than 2 weeks after the new Governments much awaited first budget. This is another great opportunity to network at the breakfast and hear what our experts have to say about the impact of the budget on the property and construction sectors and how they relate to your business. Our panel of experts will discuss the impact of this budget on a range of areas including housing, development as well as CIL (Community Infrastructure Levy) and taxation and give us specific details on property tax matters and the future complexities regarding housing, brownfield sites, green/grey belt, planning and CIL. Be a part of the discussion as we explore the big issues spinning out of the budget and how it will affect housing, development and delivery in the BCP area over the next 12 months and beyond. Our panel of experts includes: Shaun Pettitt, MD of Wyatt Homes Cathy Revis, Fiander Tovell, Chartered Accountants Alun Oliver, E3 Consulting, Property Taxation Specialists This will be a very interesting debate about how our professions can successfully navigate the budgetary challenges. We will be using the Slido app at the event for Questions and Answers. Location: Champions Top Floor Restaurant. AFC Bournemouth, The Vitality Stadium,Dean Court, Bournemouth, BH7 7AF Registration and Networking from 7.00 am to 7.25 Breakfast Served 7.30 am Panel Seminar Commences 8am Break at 8.55 am Seminar Re-Commences 9am Q&A with Slido 9 am to 9.30 am Networking 9.30 am to 9.45am Seminar Closes
1043538350297.description: Join us for our CPD Breakfast, as less than 2 weeks after the new Governments much awaited first budget we explore the resulting issues
1043538350297.event_address: AFC Bournemouth Kings Park, Bournemouth, BH7 7AF
1043538350297.title: Post Autumn Budget CPD Panel Seminar, Property Tax Update

1039380102867.summary: Energy and Buzzing are two words that are frequently used by guests to describe our Property Connector Events. You can put people together in a room, but without energy sparking off each other, nothing happens. If you want to be at an event where sparks are flying, we need to invite the right people together at the right time and this is exactly what we constantly do at Property Connector Events. Do you want to relax, have a good time, and introduce your property related business and how it can support others as well as to build long lasting, meaningful relationships? Then, you are the right person at the right time to come to a Property Connector event. At this event you will find a wide variety of guests from every area of property related businesses. People find the right people with whom to do business and widen their network. The social side is just as important as the business side when you are building the right business connections. This is the format of the evening. What to Expect: 7:00 PM - 10:30 PM: Open Networking Enjoy an extended period of networking where you can engage with a diverse group of attendees from various property sectors. Use this time to explore potential collaborations, exchange ideas, and expand your network. What Type of People Attend This Event? Our Property Connector events attract a vibrant mix of professionals across the property sector. You can expect to meet: Builders & Contractors Architects & Designers Investors & Developers Real Estate Agents & Sourcers Interior Designers Landlords Surveyors Legal & Accountancy Firms Proptech Founders Property Managers Mortgage Brokers Facilities Managers Construction Suppliers Urban Planners Sustainability Consultants By bringing together such a diverse group, the event creates a fertile ground for collaboration, learning, and networking. Location . The event takes place at the elegant bar of the Hilton Park Lane within a large private area. For the comfort of everyone attending, the maximum number of allowed geusts is 70. We recommend early booking. Pre-Event Connection: A dedicated WhatsApp group will be set up for attendees to start getting to know each other and set expectations for the event. Ticket Policy: Tickets purchased in advance are priced lower than those bought on the day and are non-refundable, though they can be reassigned to someone else if needed.
1039380102867.description: Get Ready for the Next Property Connector Event!
1039380102867.title: Property Connector in Mayfair

794096121877.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Danni Brotherston & Nick Hunt from Murmuration Partners www.murmurationpartners.co.uk (and Cotswold Lakes Brew Co. )
794096121877.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
794096121877.title: Cotswolds - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

754809163527.summary: Do you have an interest in property? Are you wanting to start, grow and scale your own property business? Stay close to other experienced property investors, be part of discussions and learn from the most forward thinking property investors & brokers in the UK property industry. Whether you have just started learning how to invest in property or have a growing portfolio, there are plenty of golden nuggets to take away from each meeting. Our vision is to bring together property enthusiasts through networking events that are fun, informal and well attended. With a strong and loyal attendee base, Moneytree Mastery Property Network has now firmly established itself as the place to meet other property focused individuals in Suffolk and Essex. You can be assured that being part of our network will reap rewards both in terms of making some great new contacts and assisting you to grow your property business. We are thrilled to have Fisher Jone Greenwood Solicitors and and Advocate Finance joining us at every meeting, providing expert insights and answer any questions you may have. Their presence ensures that you'll have access to valuable advice and guidance related to legal matters and mortgage concerns, making this event an excellent opportunity to expand your knowledge and network with industry professionals. Don't miss out on this unique opportunity to connect and learn from the best in the field. Join us at our event, and let's make valuable connections while gaining valuable insights! Everyone is welcome at our monthly networking event at The Cricketers Inn, Eight Ash Green, Colchester, held on every last Wednesday of the month at 7pm. These events are open to all, you'll find an array of property professionals and those just wanting to find out what all the fuss is about. As an attendee you have the opportunity to make new friends and contacts and really grow your property knowledge and business. Our meetings are very relaxed with no bells or whistles, we look forward to seeing you at the next meet-up.
754809163527.description: Moneytree Mastery Property Network - A monthly meet up of like minded people all interested in property at all levels.
754809163527.title: Moneytree Mastery Property Network - Monthly In-Person Property Networking

966341853497.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Kaia Vincent is the Founder and Director of Brevity , a Certified B Corporation marketing agency in Basingstoke, Hampshire. Kaia is a Marketing Fellow with over 25 years marketing experience. She established Brevity in 2010 and now employs a seven-strong team. In addition, shes a trustee for M3 Job Club in Basingstoke, an independent visitor for a child in care, and a puppy-raiser for Guide Dogs. Brevitys mission is to help entrepreneurs prioritise people, planet and profit equally. And what better way to start meaningful conversations than over a pint!

966341853497.title: Basingstoke - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

1040358840297.summary: ABOUT THE WALK Join Our Bilton Heritage Walk Explore History and Nature! Come and discover the charm of Bilton on this picturesque and historic walk! Starting at the beautiful St. Marks Church, a Grade II listed gem dating back to the 14th century, well stroll through the quaint village streets and along Lime Tree Avenue. From there, well loop through the fields near Cawston Woods, offering a peaceful countryside experience (just watch out for a few rabbit holes!). As we head back into the village, well pass through the roads of Bilton, taking in fascinating historical landmarks. Learn about Biltons rich heritage, from the ancient stone cross on the village green to Bilton Hall, a 17th-century mansion once home to writer Joseph Addison. Plus, hear a few fun facts, like how pop star Billy J Kramer was married at St. Marks in 1968. This walk is the perfect opportunity to enjoy fresh air, meet new people, and explore the stories that make Bilton such a unique place. Everyone is welcomebring friends, family, or come solo and meet fellow walkers along the way! Why you should join: Dog-friendly (social pups welcome!) The first two walks are FREE. Free sweets at the halfway point! Friendly groupa great way to meet people and dogs Scenic mix of different terrains. ROUND-ROBIN QUESTION: If you could live in any time period, when would it be? Please arrive by 6.15 pm we will set off at 6.30 pm sharp. If this is your first AG walk, then please arrive nice and early and seek out the walk leader who will be wearing a red "walk leader" pin badge. They will give you a new walkers briefing and explain how it all works. WHAT3WORDS: https://price.birds.soil Click the link above, then click "Navigate using Google Maps" . We often meet in places where there is no postcode, so we encourage you to use the What3Words app which will take you to the exact location. WALK LEADER(S): Anna Reynolds IS THIS WALK DOG FRIENDLY? Yes WHAT TO BRING WITH YOU A torch is essential (no head torches please) Bright clothing (or hi-vis vest) A drink Good footwear please. RULES TO KEEP YOU SAFE : We walk in all weathers, however, if we have a weather warning then the event may be cancelled. Keep an eye on your emails and the Facebook event page for notifications of any cancellations. We will only ever walk in groups of 15 or less. If we have more than 15, we will usually have two walk leaders and walk in opposite directions. We supply free sweets at the halfway stage.
1040358840297.description: "Discover Bilton's rich history and scenic paths, from ancient stone crosses to Shakespearean streets."
1040358840297.title: *NEW* BILTON'S HIDDEN GEMS WALK | APPROX 4.2 MILES | EASY | WARWICKSHIRE

1003171732657.summary: Come sketch and connect at this FREE weekly art club, hosted by Sketch Appeal! At these friendly and informal sessions, you'll have the opportunity to experiment with a range of materials, prompts and creative approaches - plenty of things to play with! The focus is on portraiture because we believe in - and have proved - its power to connect, empower and uplift people! These are not 'serious' art classes and we don't teach technicalities - this is all about sharing perspectives and experiences, and creating for the JOY of it. This an open-hearted, open-minded space for you to be express yourself, be yourself, and to feel the support of your community. Please note: These sessions take place within the cafe at Oxford House, so expect some hustle and bustle - though it's a fairly quiet crowd and there's no banging music! Open to all local residents aged 18+ Oxford House is accessible by wheelchair and there is an accessible toilet. Suita ble for all levels of creative experience - including those who think they "can't draw"! Email dulcie@sketchappeal.co.uk if you have any questions
1003171732657.description: A fun, friendly and FREE local art club for all! A chance to sketch and connect with others, and enjoy a cup of coffee whilst you're at it.
1003171732657.title: Time Art Club

1041173145907.summary: The Reading Marketing Meetup is an informal, friendly place for the marketers of Reading to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' not 'sell' mode We're back at the awesome Dog House offices in Friar St for this one We just want to get together, say hello, have a chat, and have a nice time. Think of this as a community event, where the focus is very much on you meeting other people in a chilled out, friendly space. The format of this one will be a little different to others, and will have more of a festive theme! Instead of the usual expert talk, we'll dive into an interactive discussion about collaborations and partnerships, what these look like, when do you know if it's the right fit, and how could finding the right out can help your business grow. In partnership with Dave Plunkett of Collaboration Junkie Bring a festive prop* of choice and join us for some collaborative networking, connections, and learning amongst friends. *Festive prop - such as a burble, glases, headband, piece of jewellery, or a Christmas jumper! Lets have a lovely night in the company of some amazin people. -------------------- The format of the night: 6.00 PM - Doors open - drinks, networking, and smiles 6.30 PM - Introduction & guided group discussion begin 7.15 PM - networking, listening, saying hello, and positively lovely people - a nice chilled out time... with mince pies 8:00 PM - End of the night - you leave with new contacts and fresh ideas -------------------- Supported by Doghouse, a workspace for business owners and curious minds alike. Check them out at https://www.tcnuk.co.uk/dog-house Supported by Force4Events, helping you find joy in marketing your next event or launch. Find out more at https://force4events.co.uk/ Supported by David Perry Media, helping content creators on tight budgets to use video more effectively. Check out www.davidperrymedia.com Supported by Mike Green Photography, specialist in people, product and work environment photography for websites, brochures catalogues and other marketing applications. See the portfolio at https://www.mikegreenphotography.com/ Supported by Oh My Nosh!, offering Private Dining, Corporate, Weddings and Events. Where there's a whisk, there's a way! Check them out at ohmynoshcatering.com -------------------- And finally... This is a donation ticketed event. The ticket price is yours to choose, from 3 to 30 (the average attendee chooses to pay 8.79 :) We of course understand that these are tough times, so if you are experiencing financial hardship and cannot afford the minimum donation amount, please reach out to el@themarketingmeetup.com and well find a ticket for you (provided capacity hasn't already been reached!) Please let your marketing friends and colleagues know about this group too, we hope to build it into a great resource for the community over the coming months and years. Attendance will be taken at this event. If you sign up but dont show up, this has a knock on effect on event arrangements. If it happens 3 times, youre outta here! This is simply a measure to allow appropriate respect to the organisers, speakers, sponsors, and your fellow community members -------------------- See you there!
1041173145907.description: The Reading Marketing Meetup is an informal friendly place to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' mode :)
1041173145907.title: The Marketing Meetup IRL: Reading

978177875357.summary: Get to know fellow neurodivergent business owners and leaders in a low-pressure, non-salesy environment that facilitates meaningful connections and provides genuinely helpful support for your business . What Makes This Networking Event Different? Structured (Yet Flexible!) Facilitated Networking: Say goodbye to awkward small talk! We've created a friendly, facilitated networking format to help you focus on the conversations that interest you and feel relevant to your business. Communication Made Easier: We understand that the pressure to engage in conversation at networking can sometimes be too much, which is why we provide colour-coded lanyards to indicate your preferred approach to communication. Choose from Green (Chat to me!), Orange (I might not be up for chatting) or Red (If I want to talk, Ill let you know) and engage with conversations on your terms, or just listen in. Quiet Space Available: Sometimes, we all need a breather. Our events will have a dedicated quiet space for anyone who feels like things are getting a bit much, so you can take however long you need to regulate and recharge. Choose From Four Different Table Activities + Discussions: Join one of our four themed tables to take part in the conversations that interest you , with an activity to focus on while you talk This event is an opportunity to connect with your neurodivergent tribe, learn from one another, support each other and explore new opportunities. Event Details Date: Wednesday 13th November 2024 Time: 18:30-20:30 Duration: 2 hours Location: Town Hall, Castlefield Rd, Reigate RH2 0SH Want to join our online events for FREE and get 50% off our in-person events? Sign up for monthly membership here and get your first month free. Event Agenda 18:00-18:30 - Arrive, get yourself a drink and snacks and choose a table 18:30-18:40 - Introduction from your hosts 18:40-19:10 - Discussions and Activities 19:10-19:15 - Five Minute Break & Hydration Reminder! 19:15-19:50 - Discussions and Activities 19:50-20:30 - Host Announcements, Event Close Please note, we may take photos or videos during this event to support us with promoting the events to reach other neurodivergent business owners and obtaining funding (as we are a non-profit). If you do not want to be in any photos and videos, please let us know and we will be certain to respect this. It is important to us that our events feel safe and that everyone who attends feels comfortable. Venue Accessibility We will be in the Old Council Hall on the First Floor in the old part of the building, where a lift is available and accessible for most wheelchair users . Find more accessibility info here. About Joyfully Different Our mission is to make business joyful for neurodivergent founders. We're an award-winning non-profit business community and learning hub for neurodivergent business owners, leaders and future founders. We believe self-diagnosis is completely valid we aim to support everyone who needs us. Want to find out more about our mission and how to sign up as a member? Head on over to joyfullydifferent.co
978177875357.description: Looking to connect & collaborate with like-minded, neurodivergent entrepreneurs? Join us in Reigate for neurodivergent-friendly networking.
978177875357.title: Neurodivergent-Friendly Networking in Reigate

810117201357.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Raechel Kelly worked in sustainable finance for 12 years, on ESG analysis and fossil fuel divestment. In 2020 she set up The Liminality , her small solo project working on climate communications and facilitation. In the same year she approached local charity Vision 21 to set up Planet Cheltenham , the town's first community climate solutions hub with the aim of empowering residents around joyful climate action. She now runs several projects including a Youth Climate Group, Little Planet Cheltenham baby group, and took part in the pilot Doughnut Economics Learning Journey as a host to some amazing local renegade economists. She is a NED at Good With Money, an RSA fellow, and you will always find her in the kitchen at parties (asking where the recycling bin is). Becki Sillence works for local climate charity Vision 21 as the communications manager for the CheltenhamZero project, a joint initiative between Vision21 and Cheltenham Borough Council supporting local organisations to move towards a Net Zero position. She has worked with a wide range of people and organisations in Cheltenham and has experience in the community, engagement and flood resilience sectors. Andrew Lansley is the Innovation Manager for Cheltenham Festivals, Senior Academic at the University of Gloucestershire and facilitator for the Cheltenham Culture Board. He works cross-sector with regional and national stakeholders to help progress the towns relationship with culture, technology, sustainability and accessibility. Andrew believes culture can play a key role in promoting sustainable economics around Cheltenham, Gloucestershire and the UK, and is involved in numerous related projects across the live events and cultural sectors.

1044741087717.summary: The event will be an opportunity to network with likeminded businesses in the area and discuss the sustainability related issues facing the world. We'll also hear from a range of speakers about what they're doing in their particular industries, and what sustainable practices you can take away to address your own goals. A light breakfast will be provided from 8:30am, featuring locally sourced food and drink. Speaker Profiles: Martin White: Four years ago under lockdown, and as part of his personal journey towards greater self-awareness of the environment and climate change, Martin founded his own sustainability consultancy Green Business Hub. Martin now advises a diverse range of private and public sector clients on their ESG strategy, encouraging them to think more holistically about sustainability rather than solely focusing on climate action and Net Zero - because they have to - to include alignment with the UNs Sustainable Development Goals and increasingly Social Value Add frameworks. Andrew Pledger: Andrew is the Ecosystem Manager at Barclays Eagle Labs in Discovery Park. The Eagle Labs mission is to connect the UKs entrepreneurial ecosystem through a network of business incubators, expertise and support. With access to over 325 years of business expertise and connections, Eagle Labs are a community resource available for everybody. Whether youre an inventor, an innovator or a mentor, Eagle Labs spaces are conducive to nurturing and growing your idea with support from Barclays and the Eagle Labs network. Sergei Panov: Head of HTPEM Product Development at ZeroAvia. Aviation is the fastest-growing source of greenhouse gas emissions. Todays aircraft engines emit substances in addition to CO2 that double or even triple aviations climate impact! NOx, contrails, and particulates have a specific warming effect of their own. Non-carbon emissions are thought to account for around two-thirds of climate impact. The Solution: Scalable hydrogen and electric propulsion technologies to drastically reduce environmental harm and lower costs. ZeroAvia's mission is a hydrogen-electric, zero-emission powertrain in every aircraft. From 19-seat regional trips to over 100-seat long-distance flights, ZeroAvia enables scalable, sustainable aviation by replacing conventional engines with hydrogen-electric powertrains. ZeroAvia are a team of passionate innovators dedicated to bringing safe, zero-emission flight to aviation, with locations in Kemble and London in the UK, and Hollister, California. Beth Janson: Strategic Business Development Manager at Countrystyle Recycling. Countrystyle Recycling is spearheading a new initiative aimed at reducing landfill waste. A family-run business based in Kent, Countrystyle has introduced an innovative closed-loop recycling program to tackle the 250,000 tonnes of coffee grounds that end up in landfills annually, contributing to harmful emissions. Through this program, coffee grounds are repurposed into nutrient-rich fertiliser, providing an eco-friendly solution that supports both environmental sustainability and businesses efforts to achieve their green objectives. Q&A Discussion Panel: A discussion panel/Q&A will follow the presentations hosted by Martin White from Green Business Hub.
1044741087717.description: Join us for our final sustainability breakfast of the year at the Barclays Eagle Lab in Discovery Park
1044741087717.event_address: The Gateway Building, Discovery Park Innovation Way, Sandwich, CT13 9FF
1044741087717.title: Sustainability Breakfast November 2024

1036699465007.summary: Exhibition tour Meet in the Lethaby Gallery for a themed tour of our CSM Observatory Show . The tour will highlight Paul Treichl's speculative biodesign pedagogy project The Department for Planetary Education , Freya Boards beautiful regenerative project The Forest Tithe Barn featuring compostable architecture and Felix McCrossen Sadler's ReRoasted : ceramic cups made from used coffee grounds. Social & Games You will then have the choice to selected a Green Game to play - all facilitated by CEN students, grads and staff: Ceremony for Hope - Climate Live Action Role Play (LARP) - hosted by Sarah Cook Reciprocity workshop - led by Rijul Narwal & Jessica Ball Climate Conversations 'Eco-Koselig' Tabletop game - facilitated by Angeline Lee Connections Along the way, find out what's coming up this year, watch our film A Movement in the Making and add your profile to our new Pollinators Directory . You will also meet this year's Climate Advocates , a group of passionate students eager to make change and co-create projects at UAL. - Ciurious about Carbon Literacy? You may also be interested in an event taking place on Nov 14: Carbon Literacy Training for UAL Students - International Action Day . Learn more about approaches to carbon data and climate change mitigation, and gain certification from a United Nations recognised programme. - If you have any questions or access needs, please email us in advance so we can do our best to support you: contact us on climatenetwork@arts.ac.uk _ images: Eco-Koselig tableptop game by Angeline Lee, MA Design Management graduate Eso-Extensions by Funmi Olawuyi, BA Product and Industrial Design graduate The Forest Tithe Barn by Freya Board, BA Hons Architecture graduate The Observatory graphic design, Eve Bull and Stephen Barrett The Observatory exhibition view
1036699465007.description: Join the Climate Emergency Network for an eco-tour of The Observatory exhibition, an afternoon of green gaming and informal networking.
1036699465007.title: UAL Climate Community Gathering

946103911267.summary: You are warmly invited to join your Local Community Partnership in Croydon Central West (which includes the East Croydon - Broad Green, Fairfield, Addiscombe West, Selhurst, Waddon & South Croydon communities). The LCP Co-Chairs Alison Johnson, Carol Trower and James Watkins along with Sarah Burns, Director of Communities for Croydon Voluntary Action (CVA) and Andrew Slegg, Community Led Support for Croydon Council are seeking your involvement in shaping the future of your area. This locality-based event will focus on: Developing the detail within our Community Plan to achieve the outcomes identified by the Local Community Partnership Establishing smaller, task-related Action Groups that use local knowledge and expertise to achieve real change Turning words into action The strength and effectiveness of each Local Community Partnership is totally dependent on how inclusive and representative the group is. So, active citizens, voluntary and community sector organisations, Council, Health workers, police, schools etc are all strongly encouraged to attend. Venue: Praise House 37 Tamworth Rd, West, Croydon CR0 1XT Your Data : Information about how CVA treats your data can be found on the CVA webpages in our Privacy Statement. More information about how CVA treats your data can be found on the CVA webpages in our Privacy Statement. Photographic Images: CVA takes photographs at training and events which are used for publicity and monitoring purposes including social media, our website, and annual report. Please let your trainer know if you do not want to be photographed, or if you have any concerns regarding this. If you require support to fully participate in this session, please contact the course organiser.
946103911267.description: Shaping One Croydon's Local Community Partnerships Croydon Central West
946103911267.title: Local Community Partnerships Croydon Central West

928102588827.summary: A regular monthly meet up to tend to the Long Wall Ecology Garden , on the banks of the Channelsea river, embedding ourselves in the site as stewards for the already existing ecosystems that thrive there, and observing how we can learn from those living systems and offer our services to reciprocate all that they offer to us. There is always litter to pick up, so we will start there for each session! Then discuss our plans already underway to plant fruit trees and build a compost toilet, and other ideas that could benefit the area. We are also installing a new green engine for our safety boat so we plan to extend this stewardship onto the waterways for future sessions too. All welcome! Drop in anytime between 11am & 1pm, and sign up here to let us know you'll be coming down. LOCATION: The Eventbrite map takes you to Abbey Mills pumping station as this is the nearest postcode - the Long Wall Ecology Garden is next door to the pumping station on the banks of the Channelsea river. Use the links for a more accurate location: What Three Words - https://w3w.co/insect.blend.being Google maps - https://goo.gl/maps/C6r3oEfE3cYe8oNf9 Access: Knowing access to blue/green space is vital for well-being, Surge endeavor to make our events and community actions as accessible as possible and improving accessibility is built into our long-term goals for the area. Currently, there are wheelchair accessible paths around the Long Wall Path site, and we invite people to communicate any access needs they may have. We can provide information in other formats and audio/visual journeys in advance, if requested. Please note, there are currently no public toilet facilities in the vicinity. If youd like to discuss your access further needs please contact: charlotte@surge.coop,. By signing up to this event you will be added to the Surge Cooperative mailing list for occasional email updates about events such as these.

1028776085967.summary: Are you interested in studying at London School of Theology? We would love to meet you and give you the opportunity to experience a day in the life of the LST community. You can participate in our weekly chapel service with student-led worship, join students for a lecture and have a delicious lunch. We will talk you through the admissions process, and you can chat with a student panel and get a tour of the campus. Whether you are interested in our Theology , Theology & Counselling , Theology & Worship or Theology & Liberal Arts programme, this is an opportunity to come and discover what LST has for you. If you are interested in studying at London School of Theology, we would love to meet you and give you the opportunity to find out more about who we are and what we do. This experience day gives you a taste of what a day in the life of a Student is like at the College. The day will include: Welcome and introduction to LST Attending a timetabled Lecture Joining the community Chapel Service Sharing lunch with others in the dining room Introduction to Student Life by the Student Committee Finding out about Funding your Studies Information about the Vocational Placement opportunities A presentation about Admissions process and Ministry Track option Taking part in a Campus Tour You will be able to find out about all of our Undergraduate Programmes, as well as our Postgraduate Taught and Research Programmes. Ticket information When ordering your ticket, please select one course Programme. If you are unsure which to choose, please select your first choice on the ticket page. There will be a good opportunity to talk to faculty and staff members from all programme departments during the day. Travel Our campus is on Green Lane in Northwood. Our postcode is HA6 2UW. Visiting by car: LST is just 15 minutes from the M25 making it very accessible from all over the UK. Free parking is available onsite. Please note that the ultra low emission zone (ulez) is just east of Green Lane, if traveling via Rickmansworth or Watford, you should not need to enter the zone. Visiting by train: Northwood is on the Metropolitan Line, about 35 minutes from Baker Street station. (Take a train that is headed for Watford, Amersham or Chesham, not a train to Uxbridge which branches in another direction after Harrow-on-the-Hill). It is also easy to connect from Aylesbury on the Chiltern line. Visiting by bus: Visiting by bus: London buses stop directly outside the campus. Number 282 (from Ealing Hospital), 331 (from Ruislip or Uxbridge) and H11 (from Harrow). Also the Watford Red Rose Service 328. E: enquiries@lst.ac.uk T: +44(0)1923 456000

1005149548357.summary: Hertsmere Borough Council's Planning team would like to invite you to our second Hertsmere Developer forum to be held on Tuesday 19th November 2024 from 10am 12pm at the Soul Deli, Elstree Film Studios, Borehamwood. We are delighted to welcome our key note speaker for the day, Catriona Riddell, Director Catriona Riddell and Associates Ltd. Catriona will be speaking on Updates to NPPF and planning reforms . Catriona is an independent consultant providing professional support on a wide range of spatial planning issues but focuses on local plans and specifically, strategic planning, working with local authorities and their partners to develop different approaches to strategic planning, including governance structures. She recently authored two linked reports on behalf of the County Councils Network [Report calls for a new planning model, as two thirds of councils say the pressure on their infrastructure is excessive due to housing County Councils Network] to help inform the Governments planning reforms and has contributed widely to the debates on devolution and levelling up. Previous roles include Head of Strategic Planning at Surrey County Council and Director of Planning at the South East England Regional Assembly where she was responsible for the Regional Spatial Strategy (The South East Plan). Catrionas other professional roles include: Strategic Planning Specialist for the Planning Officers Society (POS) Vice-Chair of the Town and Country Planning Association (TCPA) Member of the Royal Town Planning Institutes (RTPI) England Policy Panel Visiting Fellow at Thinktank Local is In 2022 Catriona was awarded an Honorary Doctorate from Oxford Brookes University for her services to Planning, was elected to Fellowship of the Royal Town Planning Institute and was included in The Planners list of top 50 Women of Influence in Planning. She is a regular columnist for both Planning Magazine and the TCPAs Journal. She has recently advised the current government on its planning reforms and changes to the NPPF. We are also pleased to Welcome Laura Wood, South West Hertfordshire Joint Strategic Plan Director (interim) who will talk to us about Strategic Planning in South West Hertfordshire . In addition, come and meet a range of officers from the across the planning team and take your opportunity to input to us. Refreshments will be provided. We look forward to seeing you there. If you would like any more information please email: economic.development@hertsmere.gov.uk
1005149548357.description: Agent and Developer Forum on Tuesday 19th November 2024 at Soul Deli Cafe, Elstree Studios, Shenley Road, WD6 1JG
1005149548357.event_address: Elstree Studios Shenley Road, Elstree, WD6 1JG

Or simply curious about what others have to say about climate issues? What to expect Listen to what your friends and neighbours think about the current state of environmental affairs. Learn about local environmental initiatives and how you can get involved. Share your hopes and fears about the climate in a 3-5 min open mic session (if youre keen!). Meet local like-minded people, chat over a drink and hopefully ease your climate anxiety. How it works If youd like to share your thoughts, please email ourplanet@sustainablestalbans.org with your name and topic. On the night, youll have 3-5 minutes to share your ideas, opinions and thoughts. When your turn is up, our compere will ring the bell and pass the mic to the next speaker. Prefer to listen to what others have to say? Make yourself comfy with a drink and feel inspired. We cant wait to hear what you share! About Our Planet Our Future Our Planet Our Future is a series of free events, walks, talks and book club sessions for those who want to move towards a more sustainable life. Discover our past and future events here . Our Planet Our Future is part of Sustainable St Albans. ourplanet@sustainablestalbans.org https://sustainablestalbans.org/our-planet-events/

911227424757.summary: Ascentis ESOL Quality Meeting (QM) What is a QM? An ESOL Quality Meeting is a free, quality-focused event that Ascentis offers for all approved centres delivering Ascentis ESOL qualifications. Quality Meetings are face-to-face events hosted by an approved Ascentis ESOL centre. This year, Quality Meetings will focus on the processes of Internal Quality Assurance and attendees will also receive an update on the ESOL qualifications and the support we provide for centres on our new ESOL Hub. There is also the opportunity to share best practices with other practitioners. Who can attend a QM? All approved Ascentis centres delivering Ascentis ESOL qualifications centre co-ordinators, tutor/assessors, exams officers and those involved in the Internal Quality Assurance of these qualifications are invited to join us. Who delivers the QM? The QM is delivered by the Lead ESOL External Quality Assurer (EQA), Ruth Simons. Ruth is a subject expert in the field of ESOL and she works in centres as an EQA so has a vast knowledge of Ascentis expectations and processes. A Quality Assurance Manager and a Product Development Manager will also be available to address QA or Qualification specific questions. Why attend? Each attendee will receive a certificate of attendance which counts towards Continuing Professional Development. It is a great opportunity for you to network with other Ascentis centres that deliver these qualifications. You will take away useful materials and information that will help with the delivery, assessment and Internal quality assurance of the qualifications. Feedback from previous QM delegates includes: Excellent understanding and supportive attitude towards centres Very organised, well managed and involved the audience as far as possible Very clear and informative We very much hope you will take up this opportunity to join with our centres to participate in important quality assurance activities. Please note that this event is for Ascentis centres only and places are limited. Please book your place using your centre email address to avoid disappointment How to get to the venue: There are no Parking Facilities avaiable at this venue Transport Links Underground: Finsbury Park (Piccadilly and Victoria Lines) Buses: 4, 19, 29, 106, 153, 210, 236, 253, 254, 259, 279, W3, W7 By signing up for this event, you are also consenting for us to be able to use your provided information for marketing purposes.
911227424757.description: An ESOL Quality Meeting is a quality-focused event that Ascentis offers for all approved centres delivering Ascentis ESOL qualifications.
911227424757.venue_name: City and Islington College - Centre for Lifelong Learning
911227424757.title: ESOL -Regional Quality Meeting

988131526997.summary: Exhibition Dates 29th October - 9th November 2024 | Willesden Gallery Private View: 31st October 2024 | 6 to 8 pm About the Exhibition Susanne Baumann presents her first solo exhibition: "Fading Echoes" - a poignant and thought-provoking collection of paintings, created between 2022 and now. She invites you to an intimate exploration of what makes someone present, and the silence and empty spaces they leave behind when they are not. "Fading Echoes" is more than an exhibition; it is an intimate narrative of Baumann's personal odyssey through the labyrinth of grief and memory. The artist's father's 20-year long battle with Alzheimer's has left an indelible mark, shaping her in profound ways. This deeply personal struggle forms the core of Baumann's current work, as she endeavours to visually express the slow and heartbreaking process of witnessing a loved one slowly fade away. Baumann's art delves into her experience of absence - not just as a void but as a tangible presence. Her paintings evoke the quiet murmurs of memories; the remnants of a presence that lingers, long after the people we knew are gone. Each piece is an acknowledgement of the continuous passage of time and the way it erodes memory, identity, and our connections to those we love. Fading Echoes is driven by the question: What remains of us when we slowly but surely disappear - is it just echoes of ourselves? About the Artist Susanne Baumann is a German artist, currently based in London. She completed her Master's Degree in Painting at the Royal College of Art in 2023, having obtained a distinction in her Graduate Diploma there in Art & Design with a focus on Fine Arts in 2022. She has co-curated, organised, and participated in group exhibitions at numerous locations throughout London, including: D Contemporary, 4 Corners Gallery, Willesden Gallery, HSBC Head Quarters, Royal College of Art, Core Arts Gallery, Citizens Art London Gallery, and Safehouse 1&2. From September to November she shows work in Shanghai at Astra Art Gallery. She was longlisted for the Visual Art Open 2023 and has been granted a place in the Professional Development Program 2024 with new platform.art.
988131526997.description: A Haunting Exploration of Absence and Memory
988131526997.venue_name: Willesden Gallery - The Library @ Willesden Green
988131526997.title: Fading Echoes

1044893112427.summary: The European Space Agency Business Incubation Centre (ESA BIC) at Leicester is delighted to host and sponsor Cosmic Coffee. T his special edition of Cosmic Coffee is hosted by the National Centre for Earth Observation. Pitches from leading climate scientists will be interspersed with our usual guest pitchers. The Conference of the Parties (COP), is held annually, with the Presidency rotating between the five recognised UN regions. This year, Azerbaijan has been selected as the Presidency of the 29th Conference of the Parties (COP29), to be hosted in Baku this November, with the theme - In Solidarity for a Green World. Cosmic Coffee is a monthly community support event designed to provide a platform for those working in and around the space community at Space City and across the Midlands, to come together on an informal basis to share ideas, receive updates about what is going on and get to know those working in this exciting and expanding sector. So, if you are already working in or interested in getting involved with space & space-enabled industries, this event is for you! Sponsored by ESA BIC, Cosmic Coffee is free to attend and will be running around the beginning of each month, so please follow Space Park Leicester on Eventbrite , Twitter , LinkedIn or sign up to our newsletter ( www.space-park.co.uk/newsletter-signup ) to receive updates about future events. Priority access will be given to those actively working in the space industry or looking to commercialise a space technology. Numbers are limited due to space at the venue so please do register early to avoid disappointment. We look forward to seeing you there!
1044893112427.description: Join us for a special COP29 themed Cosmic Coffee, with the National Centre for Earth Observation.
1044893112427.event_address: 92 Corporation Road Space City, LEICESTER, LE4 5SP
1044893112427.title: Cosmic Coffee - Global Climate Action

909541823077.summary: Please note that due to the general election this event will now be happening in December 2024 You say wot? That's right, there aren't enough wotsits in our lives, so a few times a year we co-ordinate people coming together to share some of their successes (or failures). It's a pecha kucha format, which means approx 5 presentations of 20 slides, each lasting 20 seconds. Previous speakers include those from Save the Children, Shelter, WWF, Unlock Democracy, Which?, Change.org, Care2, Let Toys be Toys, The Sunday Times, pollsters, leading academics, journalists and many more. If you have something you'd love to talk about, please let us know! Wot Wot Where? Newspeak House, 133 Bethnal Green Road. Wot Wot Who? We'll be unveiling the event list over the next week. Check back in How many tickets are there? 120 in person, we always sell out so book early and join the waitlist if you can't get in. If we have capacity we will do a virtual event too. There are 100 further tickets available for that. If you book one please note we cant guarantee we will be able to provide it, or that the production values. Wotsits volunteer power is, alas, finite. Wot if I dont like wotsits? While we grieve for what your tastebuds may miss, you can come and not eat wotsits. They are simply the snack that is provided. We dont provide any drinks so please bring whatever you would like. Alcoholic, non alcoholic, whatever floats your boat. There was once a splinter table of gin and onion rings fans. Further crisp based diversity is encouraged. Who is behind this? Ali Goldsworthy and Kate Norgrove attempt to host. Jess Day of More Onion, Usman Mohammed , Jon Date of di:ga Communications, Ruth Taylor of Common Cause Foundation and Ab Brightman of Student Hubs help too. The phenomenal Ed Saperia not only hosts us at Newspeak but helps steer the ship. The team is expanding so we can put this on more frequently. Check back to find out who else is on board. None of us get paid. You all make us laugh and we get to eat crisps. That's payment enough.
909541823077.description: Campaigning. Wotsits. Wine. The sell out corn based snack is back
909541823077.title: Wine and Wotsits Summer 2024

1031978394157.summary: Welcome to 2140Music ! Join us for an exciting event - Introduction to the New Music Economy at Brixtonia Lounge . Dive into the world of the NEW music business, learn about streaming, digital distribution, and more. Network with industry professionals and fellow music enthusiasts. Don't miss out on this opportunity to stay ahead in the ever-evolving music industry. See you there! Details Step into the dynamic world of the New Music Economy at our upcoming in-person event! Whether you're a curious beginner or a seasoned enthusiast, this gathering promises to be an entertaining, engaging and enlightening experience. At 2140Music, o ur aim is the empowerment of musicians as self-sovereign individuals, taking full control, rights, distribution, access and funding of their music into their own hands. Join us in the heart of London at a cosy venue, where you'll be welcomed into a warm and inviting atmosphere conducive to face-to-face interactions. Agenda: Let's kick off the evening with a warm welcome! Enjoy drinks as you mingle with fellow musicians and tech enthusiasts, setting the stage for an evening of amazing entertainment, enriching discussions and connections. Downstairs (Music Discovery/Networking): Enjoy live music from resident DJs and special guest performers, taking advantage of the opportunities provided in the New Music Economy! Introduction (18:30-18:40) Live Performance & Talk: Akme Beats Why 2140Music? Nat Cole, Founder @ 2140Music Live Performance: Airklipz Open Mic DJs: Akme Beats & Toxic D33p (W.O.A.H) Upstairs (The New Music Economy): Embark on a journey into the fundamental concepts of the New Music Economy, through comprehensive presentations: Part 1: Basic Understanding of Bitcoin (18:00 - 19:00) - Whether you're new to the space or seeking a refresher, this session is sure to broaden your understanding of the world's first cryptocurrency. Part 2: Introduction to the New Music Economy (19:00 - 20:00) Open Networking Session: In a two-floor venue enjoy a vibrant atmosphere with a DJ and live music as you mingle. Bring a friend along to share in the experience as you connect with like-minded individuals, exchange ideas, and forge valuable connections within the community. Feel free to let me know if you need any more adjustments! Why You Should Attend: Educational and Insightful: Expand your knowledge of Bitcoin and the new music economy, from basics to the latest advancements, through informative presentations and discussions. Discover New Opportunities: Get firsthand insights into how Bitcoin is revolutionising the art industry and creating new possibilities for creators and collectors. Networking Opportunities: Engage in meaningful conversations and build connections with fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts in a relaxed and welcoming environment. Inclusive and Welcoming: Whether you're a newcomer or a seasoned veteran in the space, everyone is invited to join the conversation and contribute to the dialogue. You can find out more about 2140Music by checking out and registering on our website here: 2140Music
1031978394157.description: Come learn about the future of the music industry at 2140Music Introduction to the New Music Economy!
1031978394157.title: 2140Music Introduction to the New Music Economy

1031062243927.summary: Sign up now for the 2025 Youth Interfaith Summit on 5 February 2025 in Central London. Hosted by the Faith and Belief Forum and the London School of Economics Faith Centre, the Youth Interfaith Summit is the largest youth-based interfaith gathering in the UK. Through expert speakers, workshops and networking, the summit will offer a space to think collaboratively about the role of faith in driving a more positive climate story for policy impact. Key Topics: Exploring Your Climate Story: Explore how you relate to the climate considering faith and other aspects of identity by crafting a human library style story. Communicating Climate Change: Explore the different methods of communicating climate change using digital media. Youth Influence on Climate Policy : Explore how young people of faith can have a significant impact on climate policy decisions at a national level. Engagement in the International Space : Explore how young people can get more involved in the climate space at an international level and why this is important. Join us for a unique opportunity to network with other young activists and engage in an important conversation about our shared future, and leave feeling inspired to advocate for collective action in your local community. #YouthInterfaithSummit
1031062243927.description: Faith & Climate: Finding your place in the narrative.
1031062243927.title: Youth Interfaith Summit 2025

1045008768357.summary: An opening event for Newham's Faith Buildings & Stories installation to celebrate Interfaith Week. Architect Shahed Saleem brings us a visual display examining the architecture and evolution of Newhams historic faith buildings. Accompanied by oral histories from faith leaders, the display also offers reflections on faith and public space and will be up for the duration of November on the windows of Green Street Library. Shahed Saleem is an architect, writer and teaches Architecture at the University of Westminster. His design, installation and research work centres on the architecture of migrant and diaspora communities and through this he explores strategies of improvisation, appropriation and collaboration. Saleem co-curated the V&A Pavilion at the Venice Biennale 2021 and his book The British Mosque was published in 2018 by Historic England which is the first comprehensive account of Muslim architecture in Britain.
1045008768357.description: An opening event for Newham's Faith Buildings & Stories installation to celebrate Interfaith Week.
1045008768357.title: Newham's Faith Buildings & Stories - Opening Launch

987121666477.summary: On the last day of our exhibition Zaha Hadid: Paper Museums on 16 November 2024 from 12:00-16:00. ZHF will host a series of free creative drawing and model-making workshops inspired by the exhibition, which will be led by architectural designer Jahba Anan and ZHF staff. The event will be a chance for visitors to have a last look at the dynamic paper relief models made by Zaha Hadid Architects. All materials will be provided and the workshops are suitable for all abilities. These workshops are drop-in and run throughout the afternoon and places are offered on a first come, first served basis. Workshops are suitable for adults and children from ages 6 upwards: Drawing workshop Model-making workshop Colouring sheets for younger age groups. All children under 12 years of age must be accompanied by an adult at all times. Venue information Entry to the building: Access to the site and building is via the black metal gate facing onto the street. If this gate is closed, please use the intercom to the right of the gate and wait for a reply. The door will then open automatically. Accessibility: Our building is step free and wheelchair accessible. There is a 7cm step from the street to our main entry gate. Please contact us in advance if you require the use our step-free alternative entry gate. We have accessible and gender-neutral toilets. Assistance dogs welcome. Filming: Personal photography is allowed in the exhibition. Commerical photography, the use of tripods and private filming is not permitted.
987121666477.description: A day of creative workshops that explore museum designers through drawing and model making. Free and drop-in.
987121666477.title: Celebrating Paper Museums

867505039927.summary: This two-day meeting will consider routes from stem cells to organogenesis and to regeneration, and how the immune system is tolerized to such processes and additionally contributes to them. The meeting will also consider the disruption of these processes in disease settings. Additionally we hope that by understanding more about the complex developmental interactions of stem cells and their progeny with each other and with immune cells, we will open doors to the various novel cell and gene therapy strategies that the symposium will also consider. The symposium will bring together internationally renowned experts who adopt different but complementary approaches, spanning basic science, developmental processes, and clinical applications, addressing unmet medical needs that affect huge numbers of people globally. Sessions will include : Epithelial stem cells; thymus biology and haematopoietic stem cells; tolerance; gene and cell therapy; immunity and cancer; organ morphogenesis, regeneration and pluripotent stem cells. Keynote lectures will be delivered by Doug Melton (Harvard & Cambridge) and by Luigi Naldini (TIGET, Milan) For a list of confirmed speakers, please check the Crick website . Full programme will be released soon.
867505039927.description: Following on from the first meeting in 2022 the 2nd Crick Stemness symposium aims to bridge stem cell biology and immunology.
867505039927.title: Stemness, Regeneration and Immunity: from development to therapy

897181081767.summary: The Diverse Business Summit, London 2024 https://thediversebusinesssummit.com/ Connecting Corporates with Entrepreneurs: Advancing Ahead The Diverse Business Summit London 2024 stands as the foremost event dedicated to enhancing the visibility, market readiness, and social mobility of diverse small businesses. This summit empowers these businesses to be future-ready, enabling them to effectively market their services to medium-sized enterprises and corporate organizations. Step into the future at the Diverse Business Summit 2024 where we unveil "Advancing Ahead," a celebration of unity , resilience , and strategic collaboration among diverse enterprises and corporates. This summit is your gateway to discovering the pivotal role of partnerships in driving visibility and fostering innovation. " Advancing Ahead " celebrates the strength found in unity and the extraordinary results possible when business groups unite, bringing their distinct strengths to cultivate an environment rich in collaboration and support. The summit serves as a trigger for merging the concepts of visibility and resilience with the creation of strategic alliances, and the vital role partnerships play in overcoming challenges and seizing opportunities with corporates. Some of the highlights of this years event include: An impressive lineup of keynote speakers, sharing their insights and expertise on the most pressing topics in supplier diversity. An exhibition featuring top suppliers to the industry, showcasing the latest products and services available to diverse suppliers. An opportunity to network with professionals, making valuable connections and sharing ideas. A comprehensive programme of sessions and roundtable debates, providing actionable strategies for improving your visibility and market readiness. Break out sessions, pitch sessions and meet the buyers LIVE Entertainment 6 Benefits to attending the summit 1. Gain exclusive access to corporate decision-makers actively seeking diverse partnerships, opening doors to contracts that can elevate your business 2. Leave equipped with a comprehensive guide to defining your commercial proposition, enabling you to successfully access corporate opportunities that yield significant contracts. 3. Learn from successful entrepreneurs like Raphael Sofuloke, Jamelia Donaldson and other entrepreneurs who have transformed their businesses from hidden gems to recognized industry leaders, and discover how to effectively showcase your offers to the right audience. 4. Walk away armed with actionable strategies, insider knowledge, and proven techniques that will not only make your business stand out but also equip you to confidently engage with corporate partners and secure contracts without the stress of traditional tendering processes. But if you want to tender for larger contracts..... 5. Our roundtable workshops and expert insights will equip you with the strategies to excel in negotiations and procurement processes. And lastly... 6. Develop a growth-oriented mindset to move from consumer to commercial conversations with confidence and finesse. Learn to navigate negotiations, articulate your value, and influence corporate partners effectively, leading to more successful and fruitful business interactions. WHAT HAPPENED LAST YEAR? The Summit has been a catalyst for tangible business growth, with numerous attendees securing funding, contracts, and collaborations as a direct result of their participation. Not only that, 11 attendees joined accelerators with our sponsors and corporate partners. These achievements underscore the Summit's role in bridging the gap between diverse business owners and the broader corporate world, offering a platform where opportunities were not just discussed but realized. A notable impact of the Summit and subsequent corporate masterminds, has been the increase in visibility for many of its participants. Several attendees have been invited to speak at other industry events , sharing their knowledge and experiences gained from the Summit masterclassess and roundtables. Others have secured training contracts, further demonstrating the value of the expertise shared and connections made during the event. The effects of The Diverse Business Summit 2023 have been far-reaching. Beyond the immediate business benefits, the event has fostered a sense of community and solidarity among diverse business owners and corporate representatives. This community continues to support and uplift its members, promoting diversity, inclusion, and innovation in the business world at large. 974234480557.summary: As the cement sector faces growing pressure to reduce emissions and enhance sustainability, this summit offers a proactive approach to navigating the shift towards greener production methods. Together, we will explore innovative pathways, share best practices, and drive progress in achieving industry-wide decarbonization. Save the date and be part of this transformative event, where we will unite to forge a resilient and sustainable future for cement production. Engage with global experts and stakeholders, and contribute to shaping the future of low-carbon cement and innovative concrete solutions. Mark your calendars for February 20-21, 2025, and join us in leading the charge towards the future of cement and concrete industry. l Driving Innovation in Cement Decarbonization & Concrete Innovation The cement industry, a cornerstone of global infrastructure, faces increasing pressure to reduce its carbon footprint. This urgency is driven by global climate goals, including the Paris Agreements targets for net-zero emissions. The sector is at a pivotal juncture, with substantial efforts focused on integrating innovative technologies and sustainable practices to achieve deep decarbonization. l Moving Forward The industry's focus is shifting towards scaling innovations from pilot projects to widespread applications. Key strategies include retrofitting plants, deploying carbon capture technologies, and embracing low-carbon cements and supplementary materials. The challenge lies in balancing technological advancements with economic feasibility and regulatory requirements. l Future Prospects The transition to a low-carbon cement industry presents significant opportunities for growth and innovation. The global push for sustainable construction materials is expected to drive market expansion, increasing demand for low-carbon and eco-friendly cement solutions. This evolving landscape promises a surge in investment and collaboration opportunities, as stakeholders across the value chain work together to achieve a sustainable and resilient cement industry. Summit Highlights: Decarbonizing Cement: Unpacking the Complexity and Urgency Scaling Up Low-Carbon Cement: Strategies for Industry-Wide Adoption Energy Efficiency in Cement Production: Maximising Potential with New Technologies Advancements in Concrete and Admixture Technology: Driving Performance and Sustainability Sustainable Cement: Exploring Low Carbon Alternatives CCUS: Building a Future with Less CO Biomass and CO2 Capture: Achieving Negative Emissions in Cement Production Innovations in Low-Carbon Cement: From Pilot Projects to Industrial Scale The Role of Supplementary Cementitious Materials (SCMs) in Reducing Emissions The Future of Clinker: Alternatives for a Sustainable Cement Industry Decarbonizing Cement: Overcoming Technological and Market Challenges Global Trends in Cement Decarbonization: Insights from Leading Markets Retrofitting Cement Plants: Technologies for Transitioning to Low-Carbon Operations Innovative Materials for Green Concrete: Challenges and Opportunities Advanced Chemical Additives: Enhancing Performance and Sustainability Circular Economy in Concrete Production: Recycling and Waste Utilization Case Studies of Successful Carbon Neutral Cement Projects - practical implementation of carbon neutral cement projects Recycling in Cement: Utilizing Waste for Sustainable Production Case Studies in Sustainable Concrete: Lessons from Leading Projects Innovative Concrete Recycling Techniques: Enhancing Material Reuse Integrating Advanced Technologies for Sustainable Cement Manufacturing Future of Green Concrete: Innovations and Market Adoption
974234480557.description: At Green Cement & Concrete Innovation Europe 2025, we will delve into groundbreaking technologies, sustainable practices, and collaborative
974234480557.title: Green Cement & Concrete Innovation Europe 2025

1039019925567.summary: This inaugural single day event will bring together academics, students, and engineers in industry working in the field of cryogenic hydrogen to share knowledge and expertise and build a community. Were thrilled to be holding the conference at the Institute of Physics ( IoP ) in central London on the 8th January, 2025 . There will be talks and panel discussions featuring world leading technical experts, policy makers, and industry representatives. In the afternoon, there will be three parallel breakout sessions focusing on research from areas identified as critical to support technology development. These areas are: Cryogenic hydrogen thermofluids behaviour Fundamental material behaviour at cryogenic temperatures and hydrogen environments Cryogenic hydrogen health and safety protocols, modelling, and testing The event will finish with a drinks and canapes reception for discussion and networking. The conference promises to be a fantastic opportunity which will bring together a range of people from across industry, research institutions and academia. We welcome abstracts for those who want to speak at one of the three breakout sessions. Speaking slots will be in the region of fifteen minutes please submit your abstract here by no later than 31 October 2024 . The successful abstracts will be selected by mid-November 2024. Tickets are on sale now! The ticket price includes full access to the conference, plenary sessions and breakouts, a selection of food and drink throughout the event and a reception. A full agenda will follow in due course.
1039019925567.description: The HCN and the CAA are hosting the inaugural Cryogenic Hydrogen Research Conference on liquid hydrogen in aviation.
1039019925567.title: Cryogenic Hydrogen Research Conference

On the day, we will be supported by excellent guest speakers from UK Infrastructure Bank (UKIB) & The Institute of Environmental Management & Assessment (IEMA) , who will provide some fantastic insight into changes ahead, and the positive opportunities this will bring across critical areas such as changing policy under a new government and the investment needed for the public sector transition to renewables . This event is not to be missed, and we look forward to hosting a day of learning , inspiration and networking .
1020504264727.description: London | 6th December | Change - A LASER Customer Event - From Politics to Policy |
1020504264727.title: Change - a LASER Customer Event 2024
