798629280677.summary: To get your 10% FORS Discount , please email info@fbgtraining.com BEFORE you purchase your ticket. IMPORTANT: When booking a ticket, you must inform info@fbgtraining.com of your full company name, so we can upload the FORS Training successfully to TFL. *LUNCH* Please note: This course includes a light lunch. For dietary / allergy requirements, please contact info@fbgtraining.com (One light lunch per candidate). Registration: Starts at 7.30am It is your responsibility to ensure you plan your journey in advance. If you do not attend there will be no refund of your course fee. If you turn up after the course has started you will be refused entry and any rebooking will be subject to a full rebooking fee. The course includes a practical on-road cycle training element and gives drivers a real life experience as to a cyclists perspective of riding on busy roads, as well as in traffic. The course consists of two 3.5-hour modules (both delivered on the same day); the first module is classroom-based theory and the second module is an outdoor practical session, where delegates are able to get a cyclist view of the road. The FORS Professional Safe Driving course highlights a drivers regulatory responsibilities, the importance of safe driving practices on motorways, rural and urban roads, and other hot topics that can negatively impact safe driving such as driver fitness, health, distraction, and impairment. The course includes a practical on-cycle session and a theory module. Both modules (i.e., the practical and on-cycle sessions) are 3.5 hours each, counting towards seven hours of Driver CPC, plus the mandatory work-related road risk training as required at FORS Silver. Work Related Road Risk (WRRR) Fleet Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) Silver level Construction Logistics and Community Safety (CLOCS) Standard Please ensure that you dress accordingly. To add, Hi-Vis sleeveless jackets and helmets are provided by FBG Training on the day and must be worn by all delegates at all times throughout the cycle element. This is for your safety. IMPORTANT: Any driver attending the course must have their identity checked by either a photo card driving licence, Operator card or a Driver Qualification Card (DQC). This will allow FBG Training to register the driver onto the Transport for London master SUD database which confirms the driver has attended the course. For a driver to be uploaded to the FORS/TfL register and/or be accredited with the Driver CPC hours they must complete the entire course. Generally, the only reasons for not taking part in the cycle element are on medical grounds, or if during the cycle familiarisation session, the driver is risk assessed as not safe to ride a bike on public roads in these instances it is acceptable for the drivers to walk the course meeting up with the cyclists at the exercise/discussion points and joining in with the discussion. You MUST bring your Driver Qualification Card to ensure you are eligible for Driver CPC periodic training. This course contains content relevant to drivers that hold a vocational category C1, C, CE. The course content is not fully aligned to drivers with a vocational category D1, D, DE. The holder of these categories, however, can attend and gain their 7hrs. IMPORTANT- Have you completed this course before? You cannot attend the same course within a 5-year period unless you have a good reason to repeat it. For more information, contact our office info@fbgtraining.com. Did you know? FORS insist all delegates complete the cycle element in all-weather types to gain your certificate so COME PREPARED. Bring suitable clothing, water and sun cream if applicable for the weather conditions on the day. Refusal to participate in the full course will result in no accreditation. Please note: Travel costs are not included. Refreshment: Tea, Coffee and Light Lunch included. (For dietary and allergy requests, please contact: info@fbgtraining.com at least 1 week prior to the course date.) Parking: All candidates MUST register their vehicle registration at reception upon arrival in order to park on site for free. It is your responsibility to adhere to this stipulation. Failure to do so may result in a car parking charge being issued. Learning Disability: If you have a learning disability and/or require additional support, please contact FBG Training at info@fbgtraining.com to let us know. Own equipment If you prefer to use your own bicycle, you may bring & use it subject to a safety check. You use this at your own risk and security. Farrow Browne and Gryspeerdt Ltd will not be responsible for the safety and security of your equipment or any damage to your equipment that may occur while using the equipment on our course. You MUST inform a member of the admin team at least 48hrs prior to the course date if you wish to bring your own bike. Contact: info@fbgtraining.com *Occasionally images or video footage may be taken on our courses. By purchasing a ticket, you are complying with Farrow Browne Gryspeerdt Ltd's terms and conditions that if images or video footage is taken, it will only be used for marketing purposes on our website or social media pages. (If you do not wish to participate in any imagery or video, it is your responsibility to contact Farrow Browne Gryspeerdt Ltd before your course date.) All bookings are subject to our Cancellation Policy and by registering for a course you are agreeing to its terms. Email info@fbgtraining.com for our cancellation policy.

798629280677.title: Professional Safe Driving Course (Dartford, Kent)

1038853939097.summary: Reshape how marking and feedback are approached. Note, this event is in Hammersmith, West London College. The resources are perfect for developing classroom management and whole-school and college teaching and learning policies. What's the refund policy? We will refund your full ticket if you notify us 24 hours before the event date.

1000651835577.summary: Spend a special day at the Science Oxford Centre. Visit the Exploration Zone, woodland and outdoor Water Lab and meet researchers, scientists and presenters! Find out how to make a star on Earth, and why fusion energy matters! See amazing science tricks with our magician, or join University of Oxford and Uncomfortable Oxford and discover some of Oxfords unusual medical stories! Tickets include time in the Exploration Zone with its 20+ hands-on exhibits and outdoors where you can enjoy trails in the woodland or make a splash at the Water Lab. 66 Impossible Things In Alice Through the Looking Glass, the White Queen declares she can believe six impossible things before breakfast! Why stop there? Richard Robinson demonstrates 66 simple magic tricks you can learn quickly, impress others with instantly - all science-based - so quick and easy to learn and IMPOSSIBLE? to understand. Brighton Science Festival Oxford Health Histories Oxford has a long and captivating history of medicine and healthcare! Travel back in time to uncover surprising tales of medical discovery and intrigue such as the strange case of Anne Greene who was resurrected on the dissecting table. Explore the more uncomfortable and lesser-known aspects of medical history, and take home worksheets to continue the journey at your own pace! Oxford Health Histories (University of Oxford) & Uncomfortable Oxford Star power: energy for the future What happens inside the sun? How can you contain a star? 1034843945097.summary: The Len Crome Memorial Conversation 2024 Date: 9 November, 2pm-3.30pm. Location: Marx Memorial Library (37a Clerkenwell Green, London EC1R 0DU) and online. About the Event: This years Len Crome Memorial Conversation will be on Public support and governmental obstruction: differing British responses to the struggle of the Spanish Republic. The participants are three leading historians of the Spanish Civil War: Paul Preston, Helen Graham and Richard Baxell. Helen Graham, an IBMT patron, and Paul Preston, the Trusts founding chair, are internationally acclaimed Spanish Civil War experts. Richard Baxell is the foremost historian of the British volunteers in the International Brigades and is the IBMTs historical consultant. This IBMT event is named after the Lancashire GP who became the chief medical officer of the Spanish Republic's XV Army Corps, including the 15th International Brigade. Tickets The event is free, although the IBMT welcomes donations to support the Trust's educational and commemorative work. The suggested donation is 10 for both the in-person event and online viewing. To make a donation, click Get tickets , select In-person ticket or Online ticket , then scroll down to complete the Donations section.
1034843945097.description: Hear three leading historians of the Spanish Civil War, Paul Preston, Helen Graham and Richard Baxell, in conversation.
1034843945097.title: Len Crome Memorial Conversation 2024:

939337081497.summary: Join us for the Thames Valley Environmental Records Centre (TVERC) Autumn Conference 2024, a must-attend event for nature enthusiasts and conservationists alike! This exciting conference will take place at the Oracle, Thames Valley Park, Reading at 10am (registration from 09:30). Get ready to immerse yourself in a day filled with captivating talks, interactive workshops, and engaging discussions led by renowned experts in the field. The conference aims to foster knowledge sharing, inspire action, and promote collaboration among like-minded individuals. Lunch and refreshments included. Programme: Talk: Harveet Purewal, TVERC Micro-Intern Student The effect of climate change on the distribution of the Brown hairstreak over time Harveet is a current biology student at Oxford University and has completed a week long internship with TVERC looking at possible distribution shifts in the Brown hairstreak due to climate change and its implications for the conservation of the species. Talk: Rob Curtis, TVERC Berkshire Biodiversity Officer Berkshire Local Wildlife Sites Update Talk: Catriona Bass Towards a Protocol for community-based plant propagation for landscape-scale meadow restoration Organisations: Long Mead Foundations Thames Valley Wildflower Meadow Restoration Project & Nature Recovery Network Catriona Bass will be drawing evidence from Long Mead Foundations Thames Valley Wildflower Meadow Restoration Project and Nature Recovery Networks community propagation of rare and slow-growing plants for their community-driven, landscape-scale restoration of floodplain meadows, now in its 6th Year. The talk will cover both data the project has collected on the community propagation of individual native species (eg seed storage, germination rates, growing times, seed viability of individual species) as well as their learning on using recycled materials and creating their own zero miles compost. Talk: Dr Julian Parfitt South East Strategic Reservoir Option: Ancient and Veteran Trees, Bats, Birds and Fungi The proposed Abingdon Reservoir (SESRO) would occupy 4.5 square miles of floodplain within the River Ock catchment, with a water surface roughly equivalent in size to Gatwick Airport. Significant biodiversity net gain has been claimed by Thames Water from a desk-based exercise and limited surveys undertaken during the winter of 2021/22. To provide independent scrutiny of Thames Waters BNG claims, a baseline habitat survey and condition assessment was carried out during the period March to July 2024. Results indicate that Thames Waters BNG claims were dependent on a significant under-estimation of the areas baseline biodiversity. These conclusions have been supported by extensive surveys across the site, data acquisition from farmers and the use of LandApp to geo-reference data and to recalculate BNG from the revised habitat baselines. This presentation will focus on the fieldwork and recording undertaken during 2024 as well as highlighting some of the wildlife that this threatened green corridor supports. Dr Julian Parfitt has worked in the environmental sector for over 40 years and has been a keen naturalist for a lot longer. As an environmental consultant and academic he has worked as an expert advisor on waste and resource management issues for major retailers, Defra and the European Commission. Now semi-retired he works as a volunteer at RSPB Otmoor and has devoted the last few months to recording the biodiversity across the SESRO area. To carry out the fieldwork he travels by mountain bike and, to this end, has cycled nearly 500 miles since the beginning of March. Local Nature Recovery Strategy (LNRS) Updates: Rosie Street, Berkshire Nature Recovery Strategy: progress update Find out about the last 12 months of work on our Berkshire LNRS, and how you can next get involved before publication. Chloe Edwards, Oxfordshire LNRS Update Speed Updates : WildCookham: " A Decaid of WildCookham", Brian Clews Wild Windsor: Expanding our work and positive impacts in RBWM", Susy Shearer Imogen Parker, Wild Oxfordshire Updates Sue Downhill, Trust for Oxfordshire's Environment Berkshire Ornithological Club Updates, Neil Bucknell British Trust for Ornithology (BTO) Updates, John Melling Local Geological Sites (LGS), Lesley Dunlop Burgess Field and local schools, Kim Polgreen Workshops: Lisa Phipps, Keep Nethercote Rural Citizen Science and Biodiversity Recording We all love taking part in big national projects such as The Big Garden Birdwatch in January or the Big Butterfly Count in the summer. All year round we can be citizen scientists and contribute important information just by recording what nature we see! Wildlife conservation relies on records and data. Knowing what species we have and where empowers us to protect them, to target biodiversity enhancement projects to support them and to monitor trends in their distribution. Citizen science allows everyone to record the nature around them, allowing a much more diverse and wider understanding of our natural world whilst building our own personal knowledge and skills. During this workshop we will consider how you can contribute data and be involved in recording biodiversity as a citizen scientist, including some demonstrations and practical activities. Marcus Simmons, The Oxfordshire Nature Project, Community Action Groups Oxfordshire How free interactive mapping tools can help local species recording Good species recording work often calls for defining, revising, sharing or printing data on which areas are of interest, what things are present in each area, and other aspects such as access, ownership, other conditions. Its also often important to show accurate locations of observations and photographs, and to create and review data entries collaboratively. Frequently theres a need to link with to current and planned interventions or development proposals. The smart way to create and interact with all this is to use an interactive mapping tool that shows your information in various ways, displayed against a chosen map background. It can also be valuable to make interactive view-only maps for easy access by the public, including linking or embedding in web or social-media pages This workshop will introduce free, user-friendly mapping tools and tips for how to easily achieve all these things. It will include a good amount of time for questions and discussions, and a briefing sheet you can have at the end. Displays: There will be a range of display stands from different recording and conservation groups which you can visit during refreshment and lunch breaks. Please indicate on your booking form if you would like to bring a display and/or leaflets. How to get there: For directions, see: Google maps . Lunch and refreshments included. There is also free car parking at the venue. Many thanks to Oracle for their continued support for this event About TVERC TVERC are a not-for-profit organisation hosted by Oxfordshire County Council. We collect, analyse and share geodiversity and biodiversity information in Berkshire and Oxfordshire to help people make sound decisions about how to develop and manage land sustainably, where to direct wildlife conservation work and for scientific education and research. There are many people collecting information about our natural environment and by collating all this information at TVERC, everyone can get a better picture of the status and distribution of wildlife.
939337081497.description: Join us at the TVERC Autumn Conference 2024 to learn, connect, and share about environmental records in Berkshire and Oxfordshire!
939337081497.title: Thames Valley Environmental Records Centre (TVERC) Autumn Conference 2024

1026906263277.summary: Land and agrarian struggles are fundamental to emancipation yet the politics of good food, in wealthy nations, is underwhelming. In places like the US and Europe, the radical promise of a post-capitalist food system and land reform tends to be watered down. Technocratic, apolitical narratives tend to dominate such as farm-to-table restaurants, regenerative agriculture, eco certifications, and nature-based solutions. The radical anti-capitalist potential of agroecology and food sovereignty becomes instead a capitalist reform. The structuring dynamics of race, class and gender become assimilated into the dominant liberal worldview. Actors, activists, and academics seeking radical food and agrarian politics draw inspiration from active political struggles such as the militancy of MST, the success of Cuban organopnicos, and the international organising of La Via Campesina. Radical international movements for agroecology and food sovereignty are crucial, especially as imperialist relations inextricably structure relations between the North and South. But the mistake we observe is the attempt to straightforwardly translate the politics of peasant movements and agroecological practices to the Global North. Instead, what is needed is a careful unravelling of the material structures and narratives that drive and maintain agriculture in the North. When proposing alternatives, the lack of engagement with the question of land (as a property relation) creates a vacuum that is filled by rural romanticisation on one side and glistening ecomodernism on the other. For some, the food and farming system will be transformed through rural landholders producing for their local community, while for others a land-sparing rhetoric drives images of overyielding industrial production and a clearing of the countryside for wild nature. While these competing narratives struggle for legitimacy, a growing Green Agenda barrels ahead that supports the status quo, veiling the landscape and labour exploitation behind it. This symposium intends to bring the land and agrarian struggles into a spatial design audience while laying the groundwork to break through these deadlocks, with an eye to synergising ecological reforms with land and agrarian change, rather than these two things being at odds. Architecture-and-landscape-oriented design tends to focus on urban narratives, concealing the global food system's detrimental impacts and forms of oppression, even though agriculture occupies nearly half of the Earths surface and more than 70% of UK land. Centring these struggles aims at proposing new ways of seeing the landscapes that fuel urbanisation processes, bringing to the fore those dependencies. It seeks to reflect on practical pathways for transformation out of the failures of the good food movement in Europe and by extension other wealthy nations. The day aims to bring together actors, activists and academics, to discuss more radical futures for agroecology and food sovereignty in the wealthy countries of the North. The first session examines land struggles in the UK today and how they hamper the imagination of radical transitions, the second looks at who is imagined as the revolutionary subject of agroecology, and we close by discussing the role of (anti)imperialist political struggles. This event is organised by the Root and Branch Collective (RBC), a scholar-activist group dedicated to research and action for a radical agrarian studies approach geared specifically to the political ecology of Europe. Rob Booth, Adam Calo, Sophia Doyle, Daniel Hartley, Alex Heffron, Olivia Oldham, Clara Oloriz Sanjuan and Alfredo Ramirez from RBC will participate. Each session will start with short guest presentations and finish with a round table discussion. 10.30 to 12.00 Session 1 Land struggles in the UK today Chaired by: Olivia Oldham (RBC) Presenters: Christabel Buchanan (Shared Assets), Keir Milburn (Abundance) and Naomi Beingessner 12.00 to 13.00 Lunch Break 13.00 to 14.30 Session 2 Who is imagined as the revolutionary subject of agroecology Chaired by: Alex Heffron (RBC) Presenters: Catherine McAndrew, Claire Ratinon (SALT, Solidarity Across Land Trades) 14.30 to 15.30 Coffee Break 15.30 to 17.00 Session 3 (Anti)imperialist political struggles (Hybrid: Online and in-person) Chaired by: Adam Calo and Sophia Doyle (RBC) Presenters: Antonio Roman-Alcala, David Gilbert and Inea Lehner (Climate Vanguard) 17.00 to 17.30 Conclusions/ Action points Image credit: David Gilbert Caption: The gate leading to Casiavera's reclaimed land in Sumatra. The letters written across the gate now read Tanah Ulayat, or Collective Land. Up until the late 1990s the gate read Dona Plantation Company.
1026906263277.description: A symposium organised by Root and Branch Collective
1026906263277.title: Locating The Agrarian Struggles For Land

1043006519577.summary: The ambitious political objectives of achieving mobility that is economically, socially and ecologically sustainable cannot be met through technological innovations, such as electrification, digitalisation and connectivity, alone. The transformation that is urgently required will only be possible if the attitudes of individuals and society change. For this reason, behavioural dynamics must also be considered in the context of space. Why, how and where people travel ultimately comes down to the combination of many different factors. There are many layers and dimensions to this individual behaviour and it must be considered in integrated planning processes. This acatech DISCUSSION (publication available only in German) is the second interim report on the project Integrated urban development and mobility planning and as such it explores behaviour as the crux of integrated urban development and mobility planning and its realisation. It highlights structural, psychological and socio-cultural factors and identifies intervention strategies that can initiate change in the behaviour of individuals and society.
1043006519577.description: Join Prof. Helmut Holzapfel (University of Kassel) as he discusses Integrated urban development and mobility planning.
1043006519577.title: Urban development, mobility planning and behaviour

Ethiopian Tej by The Colour of Gold A super sweet aged Ethiopian Tej. A unique family recipe from a generational Tej brewer. Unique and floral Ethiopian honey paired with herbal and sharp gesho aged for a silky taste. Moroccan Faranah by Ouled Thaleb A banging medley blend of five grapes from the northern tip of Africa, from a vineyard farmed by a local Berber tribe. Incredibly refreshing and truly one of a kind. South African Sauvignon Blanc by Aslina New Vintage Clean and crisp Sauvignon Blanc with mineral and citrus notes and a delightfully moreish tropical freshness. South African Cabernet Sauvignon by Mhudi This bold wine is a true reflection of a modern day Cabernet Sauvignon, showing typical cultivar characteristics with perfumed aromas of dark berries, cigar box, pepper and eucalyptus. It is well known that vines grown under dry land conditions produce red wines which are naturally rich and darker in color. South African Rose by Lubanzi Almost a year ago, we picked some gorgeous Cinsault grapes on a hot summer morning in the Swartland. After a whole-bunch press and some limited skin maceration this rose-tinted beauty set off on its fermentation journey and before we knew it -- this puppy was born. Its a one man band of fresh strawberry and cherry notes that come together to produce a sweet summer song. Don't miss out on this one-of-a-kind event that promises to delight your taste buds and expand your knowledge of African wines. Grab your friends and family and join us for a memorable Christmas celebration!

1023105485047.title: Wines of Africa, Palm Wine, Honey Tej, Morocco & South Africa - Christmas

1046717790087.summary: You are warmly invited to a fundraising dinner event hosted by Aghosh UK & Alkhidmat Foundation Pakistan , Health Workers for Palestine and PIMA (Palestine international Medical Aid) to raise funds for hot meals for the people of Gaza . Join us for an evening of delicious food and great company while you support a worthy cause. Your attendance will help provide much-needed aid to the people of Gaza. Special Guest Speakers: Palestinian Doctors with first hand testimonies, and the Two White Muslims The ongoing attacks on Gaza have brought immense hardship to 2.2 million Palestinians for over year. According to Gaza's Ministry of Health, more than 42,000 Palestinians have been killed (including over 16,000 children), thousands more remain unaccounted for under the rubble of bombed buildings, and many thousands have been repeatedly displaced. Millions of displaced and vulnerable Palestinians, including children and women, are now forced to survive in makeshift shelters and camps, enduring heartbreaking conditions, with a high risk of disease. There is no safe place in Gaza. Aghosh UK has been actively supporting the people of Gaza even before the attacks began in October 2023, working with partners to deliver life-saving assistance such as hot meals, clean water, and medical aid. By offering hot nutritious meals in Gaza, we aim to meet the urgent needs of displaced families, providing not just sustenance but also restoring a sense of dignity and hope at this critical time. Find out more about Aghosh UK's recent work in Gaza and beyond here: https://www.facebook.com/aghoshuk Please join us with your family, friends, and community to support the people of Gaza. All proceeds from this event will go directly towards delivering emergency hot meals to the people of Gaza. The evening will include: Presentations by eminent guest speakers*** Update from the field 3-course meal Fundraising Get your tickets today - only 20 per person. Children 7 years old and below are free. ***We are honoured to be joined by the following guest speakers: The Two White Muslims : Junaid Rahim and Muhammad Yusuf Bashford are two English Muslims who have been practising the faith for many years. They are very active in educating people about Islam and Muslim culture as the "Two White Muslims", and they are also Aghosh UK Ambassadors, promoting and sharing the of Aghosh UK. Find out more here: https://www.youtube.com/c/TwoWhiteMuslims Dr Othman Atef : Dr Othman Atef was working in Al-Shifa hospital in Gaza when Gaza was attacked. He will share an eye-witness account of his experiences. Dr Adeel Riaz is a GP Principal and Trainer based in South Staffordshire. He is also the Chairman of Aghosh UK and the Co-Founder British Islamic Medical Association. He is also an expert in managing emergency humanitarian responses. Even if you can't attend, please extend your support and donate by clicking here: https://aghosh.co.uk/palestine-emergency-appeal/ For further information about the event, please contact: Muhammad luqman 07977120297 Dr Usama 07861610128 Mushood Ahmed Mir 07903819183 Naveed Qamar 07587479759
1046717790087.description: Charity Dinner hosted by Aghosh UK, AKFP, with special guests incl. Two White Muslims,Dr Othman Atef - join us to support Gaza
1046717790087.title: FUNDRAISING DINNER IN AID OF GAZA

1029899987587.summary: Hello Beautiful! As the night of Halloween and Samhain's sacred festival approaches, we celebrate a time when the veil between the physical and spiritual worlds is at its thinnest. This is a powerful moment to honour the cycles of life and death, to reflect on the past, and to connect deeply with our inner selves and those who have come before us. Join me for a profound Sound Bath experience where we will journey through the healing vibrations of sound, allowing ourselves to access a deeper state of awareness. Through the gentle resonance of the bowls, gongs, and chimes, well create a space for intuitive connection and honouring our ancestors and loved ones who have passed. We will start with Drum Journey and flow with Mars gong, finishing with Angelic Vibrations and Crystal Singing Bowls. Our Soul simply calls us to join into those sessions. So if you feel call - let your Soul Guide you. At this session, you will discover the benefits of Guided Meditation, Chant and Sound Healing, particularly with the use of Gong. The vibrations of the Gong can penetrate deep into our bodies, where we often hold onto unexpressed emotions that can create blockages. Allowing the Gong to travel through these spaces, helps to unravel these knots and emotions, creating new openings and allowing us to process and experience peace. You will be also experiencing instruments such as the Shamanic Drum, Water Drum, Chimes, Voice, Light Language, and Shakers. These will facilitate Sound Healing, which will enhance your physical and energetic well-being. Minor instruments are used to harmonize with your energy and heighten your experience. We will conclude the session with a period of silence to allow for integration, after which I will bring you back to the present moment. Let me share with you some of the most common benefits of Sound Baths: - better pain management, - reduced stress, - fewer mood swings, - improved sleep, - less chronic pain and blood pressure, - better productivity, - and many many more. After holding a Sound Bath, I notice a significant change in people's appearance. Their eyes seem to sparkle with newfound vitality, and their souls appear more present. Their faces lift and brighten, and the stress seems to disappear from their expressions. They also seem to carry less weight on their shoulders. I highly recommend attending this event to everyone. Sound Baths are excellent modern tools that aid people in living a calmer and more present life in the fast-paced world of today. If you're already looking after your well-being or want to start doing so, this tool can significantly enhance your energy levels, help you relax, and manage your stress. DETAILS: Location: 89 Melison Rd, London SW17 9AS Parking: Free parking on streets outside the venue. Time: 7:30 pm - 9:00 pm Please arrive from 7:15 pm - so we can start on time @ 7:30 pm. I will meet you in the hall. Doors will close at 7:30 pm, as not to disturb the session. Please make sure to come on time and check your journey ahead. In case of any delays please text. Please don't drink any alcohol before the event. WHAT TO BRING & WEAR: It is advisable to wear comfortable clothing during the sound bath session, as you will be lying on the mat for almost an hour. In addition, your body may feel cooler than usual, so layering can be a good option. Don't forget to bring a water bottle to ensure you stay hydrated before and after the session. Bring a yoga mat, blanket, sleeping bag, and cushion, eye mask or pashmina - create your wonderful nest for yourself. Please be aware that I don't have those in the hall. Exchange: Regular Ticket 22 + fees BRING FRIEND: Ticket for 2 people for 40 + fees For other payment methods - contact me, please. Minimum age of 18 for individuals. If you would like to bring a child, 14 years old is a minimum. ***Please be aware that our events aim to provide holistic energy healing to your entire being, which may occasionally uncover old emotional layers that need to be cleared. If this occurs, please remain mindful of what is happening and allow the processing to take place. ***Before attending the event, it's important to consider any previous injuries, surgeries, or chronic illnesses you may have. It's crucial that you feel confident in taking full responsibility for your participation. For pregnant women, it's recommended to avoid participating in sound baths during the first trimester. * ** Contradictions: claustrophobia, schizophrenia, bipolar, extreme sensitivity to sound, epilepsy, seizure disorders, uncontrolled arrhythmias, recent heart attack, very recent surgeries or broken bones. * ** Contact - If you have any questions or conditions and you not sure if Sound Bath is a good choice for you, please contact me on M: 07752162727, E: anna@tunewithin.co.uk and we can chat about it for more clarity. CANCELLATION POLICY: In light of cancellations and no-shows, a new refund policy has been established to ensure clarity and commitment from all attendees. By reserving a spot, you agree to the refund and cancellation guidelines and confirm that you have read them thoroughly. As this event has limited capacity, refunds are not available. However, if you are unable to attend, you may transfer your ticket to someone else. Kindly notify me of the transfer, and I will do my best to assist you. Please note that any Eventbrite fees are not included in the transfer. Additionally, a few photos will be taken for promotional purposes, but if you prefer not to be featured, kindly inform me, and I will exclude you. Thank you for your cooperation and understanding of these policies. If You are interested in the science behind sound healing, you can find it in these videos: https://youtu.be/O7MmSfo5b9U - Bruce Lipton explains how it works https://youtu.be/yUNqN0G-7Zw - blood tests after 20 minutes of Gong ANNA BOJARYN I am Healing Practitioner, Usui and Angelic Reiki Master, Workshop Facilitator, Teacher, and Founder of Tune Within. My mission is to create simple, nurturing healing spaces where individuals can connect with their inner selves, release stress, and rediscover joy and lightness. As a guide on spiritual journeys, I help people let go of emotional baggage, shift their energy, and release layers of conditioning that diminish their light. I support deeper inner work, helping individuals expand their inner light and connect with their unique gifts and potential. For more about my work, please visit my Instagram or my website at tunewithin.co.uk I am genuinely excited to create this beautiful sacred healing space for you!!! See You !!! Anna

1034675892447.summary: The Centre for Commercial Law Studies at Queen Mary University of London is delighted to host a book launch for Rules for Trade in Services 2.0 Adapting the GATS to a Changing Trade Landscape (Routledge, 2024), written by Gabriel Gari, former Reader in International Economic Law at this institution. The book explores the adaptation process of the General Agreement on Trade in Services (GATS) to a constantly changing trade and policy context. Back in 1994, the adoption of the GATS, a multilateral agreement with stand-alone rules and principles for the governance of trade and investment in services, represented a watershed in the history of global trade governance. Three decades after the adoption of the Agreement, WTO Members struggle to deliver on the GATS mandate to achieve progressively higher levels of trade liberalisation in a radically different trade and policy landscape. Digital technologies have transformed the way we trade, what we trade, and who trades like never before. The rising number of Preferential Services Agreements contest the role of the GATS and the WTO as the centre of gravity for the governance of trade in services. The rise of China to the centre stage of world trade has altered the balance of power underpinning the multilateral trading system. Pressing environmental challenges and national security concerns are making it increasingly difficult to reconcile free trade with non-trade policy concerns. In years to come, additive manufacturing, the internet of things, distributed ledger technology, and artificial intelligence will continue to reduce trade costs, blurring the distinction between goods and services and raising the relevance of data flows and intellectual property. Against this background, this book examines the contribution of the WTO negotiating, adjudicative, and deliberative functions to adapting the GATS to changing trade and policy circumstances. The book uncovers an extremely flexible and adaptable agreement whose full potential has yet to be realised due to a complex set of non-service specific factors. The book distils the factors at play that constrain WTO Members capacity to adapt the Agreement to changing circumstances and explores potential pathways to overcome them. The author will present an overview of the book followed by reactions from four discussants in a thought-provoking discussion about the future of the GATS in a fast changing trade and policy landscape. The event will be followed by a drinks reception for those in attendance. This event is hybrid.
1034675892447.description: Adapting the GATS to a Changing Trade Landscape (Routledge, 2024)

1007801640837.summary: It is with the utmost pleasure and a heart full of anticipation that we extend to you a most cordial invitation to Cianna's Smile Spring Soire a grand affair of elegance and purpose. On the evening of Saturday, the 17th of May, in the year 2025 , we shall gather at the splendid Hilton Reading from six oclock in the evening until the stroke of midnight , to partake in a gala that is as enchanting as it is vital. Our noble aim is to raise awareness and support for those who bear the burden of sickle cell disease, with the hope of providing a much-needed respite for 100 families during the summer months. The evening promises a delightful array of experiences, commencing with a most refined drinks reception , followed by a sumptuous three-course dinner . The night will be adorned with entertainment to delight the senses, an exciting raffle and auction to inspire your generosity, and a lively disco to dance the night away. Your presence will not only grace us with your company but will also contribute to a cause of profound significance. Together, we shall make a difference in the lives of those who need it most. Prepare to be a part of a night that will be remembered fondly by all who attend. Theme: Spring Elegance with a Touch of Bridgerton Dress code: Ladies: We invite you to embrace the grace of the Regency era with gowns in soft, romantic hues inspired by the blooming beauty of spring. Consider pastel shades such as lavender, blush pink, soft yellow, mint green, and sky blue. Dresses should be floor-length or tea-length, with delicate details such as lace, ruffles, or floral embellishments. Gloves, pearls, and elegant updos are encouraged to complete your ensemble. Gentlemen: For the gentlemen, we suggest classic formal wear with a nod to Regency sophistication. Tailcoats, waistcoats, and cravats are encouraged in spring-inspired colors such as dove grey, powder blue, or ivory. A well-tailored suit with a crisp white shirt is also appropriate. Consider adding a touch of vintage flair with a pocket square, cufflinks, or a top hat. Accessories: Accessories should complement your attire while capturing the essence of the Bridgerton era. Ladies may wish to don delicate jewelry, while gentlemen may consider period-inspired details to enhance their look. Footwear: Shoes should be formal and in harmony with the elegance of your attire. Ladies may choose dainty heels or ballet flats, while gentlemen should opt for polished dress shoes. We hope you will enjoy embracing this theme and look forward to seeing the splendid array of styles that will grace the event. Your adherence to this dress code will add to the charm and atmosphere of the evening.

93464513877.summary: Ghana Tech Summit - Diaspora Edition It is with great pleasure that we invite you to attend the 2024 Annual Ghana Tech Summit. Ghana Tech Summit brings together hundreds of entrepreneurs, investors, digital marketers and creatives under one roof together to address humanitys greatest challenges via technology and entrepreneurship. Ghana Tech Summit Launches Historic Diaspora Edition for 2024 ATTN: Ghana Tech Summit ( Diaspora Edition) MEMO: An initiative hosted by the Global Startup Ecosystem (GSE) with accelerator ecosystem support by Google Cloud, AWS, IBM Cloud. Global Startup Ecosystem (GSE) is pleased to announce the Ghana Tech Summit titled the Diaspora Edition". With the theme of galvanizing the Diaspora towards a new future for Ghana- the program will be hosted outside of Ghana for the first time and convene 300 leaders from around the world in New York City during the United Nation's Assembly Week. The iconic program will be hosted outside of Ghana for the first time. This invite only gathering will feature leaders in multiple industries including investors, government officials, startup leaders, universities, and more. The History of Ghana Tech Summit: Ghana Tech Summit has a multi year history of bringing together global leaders and local stakeholders together to advance Ghana as a leading tech hub in Africa. The summit launched in 2018 with 100 speakers and 1000 attendees featuring pioneers from leading companies such as Google, Facebook, Uber, Twitter, IBM, Microsoft. The theme was centered around Transforming Ghana into the No.1 Tech hub of Africa and Future Tech Hub of the World. The 2019 summit returned with 2000 attendees and the same line up of top tier companies during the Year of Return with the new theme Sankofa Go back and get it and rebuild- Year of Return. The pandemic took hold in 2020 and Ghana Tech Summit continued its work with virtual and hybrid editions. The 2020 edition welcomed over 11,000 global digital delegates during the Beyond the Return with the theme 2020, The Decade for African Renaissance. The 2021 edition Building The Workforce of the Future was centered on youth unemployment and Africa having the worlds youngest population in the world and how that can transform the workforce of the future. The 2022 edition aimed to gather thousands for the next era of the internet. The metaverse & edition welcomed 17,000 stakeholders on the future of Africa in a digital first world. This edition revitalized interest in the tech revolution opportunities in Ghana and Africa by sparking the continents first ever metaverse edition and sparking a new wave of interest into Web 3.0. The 2023 edition focused on a series of tech training programs across Ghana over the span of 12 months. The 2024 edition focused on a renewal of tech stakeholdership with the convening of a high level roundtable in during December in Ghana activations. Invitations to stakeholder leaders are underway and members of the public are invited to join us virtually to engage in the discussions. A report summary will be presented at the conclusion of the stakeholder engagement forum. For ways to partner, engage and participate, email the team at events@globalstartupecosystem.com . Ghana Tech Summit Team (E) events@globalstartupecosystem.com (W) www.ghanatechsummit.com * Please note - no refunds.
93464513877.event_address: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza, New York, NY 10017
93464513877.venue_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza

This event will feature a conversation with Astrid Atkinson, CEO of Camus Energy, moderated by climate journalist Lisa Martine Jenkins of Latitude Media. Together, theyll explore how the growth of electricity demand, spurred by electric vehicle adoption and AI data center expansion, is changing how utilities plan for and operate the electric grid. After the discussion, enjoy light snacks, drinks, and the opportunity to network with like-minded professionals who are passionate about the future of clean energy. Space is limited, so register early to secure your spot! This event is hosted by the Young Professionals in Energy (YPE) New York Chapter and the Clean Energy Leadership Institute (CELI), with venue sponsorship from our friends at NineDot Energy and food and beverage sponsorship from Camus. 1008131768257.summary: What to Bring A candle A pre-written journal entry (prompt below) Anything else you'd like at your altar (crystals, tarot, etc) What to Expect Whether you have never been to a circle before or this is your 15th time, I welcome you. No two circles are ever the same. The evening starts with happy hour and light refreshments before settling into circle as a group. We meditate to my Nepali singing bowls and then we will read one another's journal entries out loud. Please don't worry - all of us are in the same boat (I write an entry, too) so it's completely okay if you feel awkward or vulnerable about your thoughts being shared. Try to write from the heart as much as possible. We don't have enough spaces for true open, non-judgmental dialogue anymore and that's the goal of this circle and community. What to Write Please write 1-2 pages typed up on your phone/computer or handwritten in response to any of the following questions. Take a look at the next section below for more inspiration. How can I assert my individuality and desires (Aries energy) while maintaining balance and harmony in my relationships (Libra energy)? What fears or old patterns am I ready to release under this full moon, and how can embracing both my fiery drive and my need for connection help me transform? As I reflect on the themes of courage and partnership, where in my life can I boldly take the lead while still honoring the partnerships and collaborations that support me? What's going on in the cosmos? October's full moon is the 3rd of 4 consecutive supermoons this year, which means it's extra potent energy as the moon is much closer to the Earth than usual. It's called the Blood Moon (or sometimes, Hunter Moon) which, in indgenous traditions, signaled a time that hunters started hunkering down and preparing for winter. This month also instills feelings of "spooky season" with Friday the 13th, a solar eclipse, and a lunar eclipse coming up on Halloween weekend. This spooky spectacle doesn't occur often so we might all be feeling this energy extra potently. This moon occurs during Libra season, a very balanced and rational sign rooted in planning and structure. Yet it occurs in the sign of Aires, a firey warrior sign that coincides with the hunter moon nicely. Many themes of this moon will relate to the balance between our inner, impulsive warrior and the part of us that likes to keep the peace or harmony in our relationships. While Aires is very focused on pursuing their own goals and desires, Libra is the sign of relationships and harmony - so this full moon may bring up themes around self versus other. Full Evening Agenda 1. MOONSHINE & GROUND RULES We'll mix and mingle for a bit until everyone arrives. There will be light refreshments and snacks served for a happy hour before settling into our circle. Then we'll go over the basics to set up a mindful space for sharing. 2. SET INTENTIONS & LIGHT CANDLES We go around the circle and state 1 thing we hope to gain from this experience as we each light our candle in front of us. 3. MEDITATE We'll spend 10 minutes meditating by candlelight to the sound of my singing bowls lovingly made under a full moon in Nepal. Spend time reflecting on our goals, connecting as a group, and getting in touch with our bodies as we enter zen self-reflection mode. 4. INTROSPECT This will be a large part of our evening. One by one we will read each other's journal entries aloud to the rest of the group. The purpose is to have a space to be purely heard. No dialogue yet, just listening. 5. EXTROSPECT Dialogue ensues. Each circle member gets the chance to comment on whichever they heard from others. Did something evoke a strong reaction? Make you think in a new way? Feel free to share anything that comes up. 6. GRATEFULNESS & GAIN Each member of the circle states one person/place/thing they are grateful for having or currently experiencing in their lives. 7. HOPEFUL LOSS Circle members state one thing they hope to reduce/lose/let go of in the coming weeks as they blow out their candles one by one 8. CLOSING THOUGHTS A chance for open dialogue, feedback, connecting with other members of the circle and easing back into the routines of life before going back off into the dark of the night.
1008131768257.description: A gathering of women under the moon at a spiritual family home with a happy hour, sound bath meditation, journal sharing and open dialogue
1008131768257.venue_name: Address will be sent upon sign up (Off 30th Ave Subway Station)
1008131768257.title: Women's October Full Moon Circle

1043166738797.summary: The Gotham Gator Club and UF First-Generation Alumni Association invite local Gator Fans ( Alumni and Non-Alumni family and friends ) to volunteer with the GlamourGals Foundation for their 22nd Annual Leadership Training Institute. RSVP here to meet us at the offices of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton, & Garrison at 1 285 6th Ave on Saturday, November 23: GLTI Signup Link Volunteer roles are split into two categories: Team Leaders and Event Staff. Team Leaders Team Leaders are responsible for managing a group of about 10 high school and college students throughout the day. Team leaders facilitate activities, engage students, and serve as mentors and role models throughout the day. Team leaders must stay for the entire duration of the day (8:00 AM - 3:00 PM) and attend a 15-20 minute Zoom training the week leading up to GLTI. Event Staff Event staff will help with registration, the "behind the scenes" program needs, set up, clean up, meal breaks, and gift bag distribution. There are three volunteer time slots: morning (8:00 AM - 12 PM), afternoon (12:00 PM - 3:00 PM EST), and all day (8:00 AM - 3:00 PM) . T-shirts will be provided to volunters. Further information will be provided to volunteeres in early November. Have questions about this event in the meantime, please email volunteer@gothamgators.com . Go Gators!

Cuando la Kundalini se eleva, ilumina todos los centros de energa, trayendo iluminacin fsica, emocional, mental y espiritual. Ah encontramos nuestra paz interior. Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi , fundadora de Sahaja Yoga Meditation

1047198016457.summary: Fallou Wadje is a Harlem based Senegalese artist and fashion designer who was named after the century-old Senegalese tribe and spiritual practice founded by Wadjes great-great-grandfather, Maam Cheikh Ibrahima Fall. She uses art for her own healing as she expresses spirituality through fashion and art. She believes by decoding her own healing through her work, that same energy will be shared with her clients; to awaken, challenge and uplift their conscienceness. And that her creations brings healing. She started doing art two winters ago. Her latest work are coloful abstracts that combine spirituality with art, uses both English and Wolof words, symbols and dynamic movement to create unique digital print collages, and is built as compositions about the memory of Senegal and about her life in Harlem.

490810476347.summary: * This event is FREE for all job seekers & new recruiters. The event is conducted on the First Friday of Every Month, 11 am - 2 pm in your local timezone! FAQ: Q: What is the CareerClub Virtual job fair ? A: CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month, from 11 am to 2 pm, in your local city. It is a global virtual job fair for effective hiring among local professionals and recruiters and to promote healthy professional networking. CareerClub Virtual job fair, started as a small project to take the anxiety away from recruiters and professionals by making it available every month, and delivering it virtually, has now been deemed an industry standard and has encouraged several other organizations to join us and make their job fair monthly. Few even took it to the next level and joined us by taking their job fair globally through our platform. CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month from the convenience of their home, with no travel, no dressing formals, and no anxiety-led career event. A community-driven job fair where professionals, recruiters, and service providers come together to promote happy and healthy hiring. Q: Why should I attend the #CareerClub #Virtual jobfair? A: This global event is attended by thousands of recruiters to connect with 100s of thousands of seekers. This community-led event is where professionals spread the word and invite communities to job fairs. Some benefits: 1. Connect with local/global talent and opportunities 2. Collaborate with other professionals and never grow alone 3. Get access to resources to support long-lasting career growth Have more questions? Visit Event FAQ/Reachout Page at: https://jobfair.nwlb.app Q: Where is the event conducted? A: This is a virtual event, which means no travel is required. The event is conducted over your favorite internet browser. All you need is the following: Email(sent 24-78hours before) confirming you are assigned a room. An ability to chat, and if there is a common interest, go to a video/audio session( virtual rooms are provided ). A well-lit and quiet room where you could have a good session. Q: Is there a dress code? A: If you have received a note about your confirmed room, you would be encouraged to attend with respectable, semi-formal, and comfortable clothing. Q: Who could attend the event? A: This event is designed to help professionals [who are looking for work or exploring the market], recruiters [who are on the lookout for talent for their open roles], and service providers [who could assist professionals with their pursuit of a successful career]. Q: Which companies are attending? A: Amazon, Apple, CVS Health, United Health Group, Microsoft, Walgreens Boots Alliance, Kroger, The Home Depot, Verizon, Ford, General Motors, Anthem, Comcast, Bank of America, Target, UPS, Procter & Gamble, PepsiCo, FedEx, Disney, Albertsons, Prudential, Sysco, Best Buy, Allstate, AIG, Progressive, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Caterpillar, Dow, VA, Northrop Grumman, USAA, Dollar General, TJX Companies, Walmart ... and 8000 other businesses trust the platform for their recruiting. Q: Is this ticket enough, or do I need anything else to join the event? A: Participation is simple and effective: 1. Signup/register & RSVP with the platform at https://jobfaircc.nwlb.app 2. Stay on your emails for the next steps to attend. Q: What are the system requirements for attending the event? A: All you need to attend the event: Computer or Mobile Phone [No App is required] Broadband access [we advise 1.5 Mbps minimum for the best experience] A webcam(in case of a video call) Q: Which industries are visiting this event? A: This is a global event, and our communities are a mix of several industries, some of them include: Advertising, Aerospace, Agriculture and Agribusiness, Air pollution, Arms, Automotive, Broadcasting, Chemical, Computer, Construction, Creative, Defense, Education, Electric power, Electronics, Energy, Entertainment, Fashion, Film, Financial services, Fishing, Floral, Food, Healthcare, Horticulture, Hospitality, Industrial robot, Information, Insurance, Internet, Leisure, Low technology, Machine tooling, Machining, Manufacturing, Market research, Mass media, Mass production, Materials science, Meatpacking, Mining, Music, News media, Occupational injury, Occupational noise, Oil shale, Petroleum, Pharmaceutical, Pricing, Professional Services, Publishing, Pulp and paper, Raw material, Real estate, Robber baron (industrialist), Semiconductor, Services, Shipbuilding, Software, Sport, Steel, Telecommunications, Textile, Tobacco, Trade association, Transport, Video game, Water, Wood, etc. Q: Who are the people behind this event? A: #NoWorkerLeftBehind *, a global non-profit, is behind this event to democratize healthy career development for all, using technology to assist the global workforce to stay closer to their aspirational success through a healthy network, adequate knowledge and more opportunities. * NoWorkerLeftBehind is always on the lookout for professionals/organizations who want to actively work to help create a more equitable and just workforce that provides opportunities to everyone and creates an ecosystem of mutual growth and success. Interested in assisting us? 1038498736677.summary: While tickets are sold through Green Room 42's website , you can further support our performance by making a donation here. Your contribution will help cover venue fees and allow us to continue creating beautiful music and unforgettable experiences. Thank you for being part of our journey! Official Ticket link for Selecting Seats: https://thegreenroom42.venuetix.com/show/details/z7X12DI1CQwLdPrTAOXj Join us for an unforgettable one-hour concert where music lovers from all walks of life can come together to celebrate the beauty and diversity of musical expression. **Lena Wu** (Carnegie Hall debut, *Harmonies of Two Worlds*) leads an extraordinary lineup of talented performers, including the rising baritone **Chisom James Maduakor** (Brooklyn College), the soulful cellist **Ray Cheng** (Manhattan School of Music), and renowned pianist **Eric Sedgwick**. Together, they will take you on a melodic journey through some of the worlds most beloved musical genres. This concert offers something for everyone, showcasing the profound artistry of **opera arias**, the captivating drama of **Broadway show tunes**, the accessibility and emotion of **pop hits**, and the elegance of **classical music**, all enriched by the unique sound of the **cello**. Audiences will also be treated to the evocative beauty of **Chinese folk songs**, blending traditional Eastern melodies with Western techniques for a rich, cross-cultural experience. Expect a showcase of professional musicianship and passion as our performers present tuneful and recognizable pieces that touch the heart and stir the soul. This event is more than a concertits a chance to connect. Art lovers and music enthusiasts alike are invited to stay, mingle, and make new friends in a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you're here to appreciate great music or to meet like-minded individuals, this event creates the perfect space for both. **All art lovers are welcome** to this celebration of great music, artistry, and community. Dont miss out on this evening of tuneful masterpieces, shared experiences, and new connections!
1038498736677.description: Experience the richness of classical music alongside the joy of Broadway and pop melodies, all performed with passion and elegance.
1038498736677.title: Harmony Across Genres: Classical, Opera, Broadway & Beyond

1026500690197.summary: Join us for Green Easel Art Club's third meet-up on Saturday, October 26th at 2:00 pm in Central Park by the Belvedere Castle(exact pin will be sent 1 hour before the event to those signed up). For updates, follow us on Instagram . Theme: All Things Autumn For our third meet-up, we will be taking a slightly different approach by working on a theme instead of a specific art. So, whether you are looking to paint a piece, collage, crochet a beanie, or make yourself a bracelet...draw inspiration from the crisp, cool air and colorful leaves around to create your masterpiece. Green Easel Art Club meetings are potluck style, so we bring supplies and are willing to share with others. Don't panic if you don't have any art supplies; the organizer will be getting some (limited supply). The art club is open to all skill levels. You will have the opportunity to create whatever you'd like, either alone or even together with someone. Some reference art books and images will be available if you need inspiration. You can follow your intuition, ask a club member to show you a technique, or even work on any other art project beyond what is mentioned above (remember to bring relevant supplies or let me know in advance so I can look into arranging supplies for you)! Bring snacks, water, sunscreen, and a picnic blanket (unless you are comfortable sitting directly on the grass). Plus-ones are encouraged; register for the event accordingly. In case you cannot make it, cancel your ticket so we have the right headcount. As always, I look forward to meeting under the trees and crafting away the fall afternoon. Once I find a cozy spot for us by the Belvedere Castle, I will share an exact pin location on the day. Be sure to follow @greeneaselclub.nyc on Instagram for updates, and read our rules below. - Hate and bigotry are not tolerated. - Be open to sharing supplies. If you bring something you don't wish to share, no problemkeep it near you or let people know politely. - Treat art supplies and the space with love and leave no trace behind. - Keep track of your belongings. Green Easel Art Club is not responsible for items left behind. We will round up anything left and let folks know. Please ensure you follow up if you want to collect it. Please note that all attendees consent to being photographed and videoed, which may be used for marketing or promotional purposes. We will try our best to keep it to a minimum. :)
1026500690197.description: An art club that meets monthly in different NYC Parks and crafts away the weekend afternoon.
1026500690197.title: Green Easel Art Club Meetup #3: All Things Autumn

979015239937.summary: Delight in the autumn colors and shibori shapes brilliantly animating the Fall 2024 collection by Suzusan , internationally acclaimed design studio based in Dusseldorf, Germany and Arimatsu, Japan. Meet Hiroyuki Murase, Creative Director and chief designer of Suzusan. Hiroyuki is the mastermind behind the fusion of shibori heritage craft with contemporary design in fashion, home, and living. The Murase family in Arimatsu, Japan have been masters and innovators of the shibori craft for five generations. Meet Yoshiko I. Wada , a renowned textile scholar and the author of two definitive publications on shibori. Yoshiko, along with Jack Lenor Larsens seminal publication, established Dyers Art in the West. Relish an opportunity to exchange ideas and share inspiration with these two influencers of fashion design and textile scholarship. Admire and acquire Suzusan's exquisite Shibori products, their seamless cashmere knits and other fine textiles hand-dyed in Arimatsu, Japan. Suzusan Press & Collaborations: Milan Fashion Week, Fall/ Winter 2024 Asia News Netork December 2022 Suzusan x Kimono Yamato CO-HOSTS: Hiroyuki Murase, Suzusan , Creative Director. Dsseldorf and Arimtasu Yoshiko Iwamoto Wada, World Shibori Network Foundation, Founder and President. Berkeley, CA and Leicester, UK PROGRAM: Brunch, Shibori Talks & Demos, and a Preview of the Fall 2024 Suzusan Collection Wednesday and Thursday, November 6 and 7, 2024: 10:00 - 12:00 $300 Supporter ($225 tax-deductible) $500 Patron ($425 tax deductible) $1000 Benefactor ($825 tax-deductible): You will be invited to Dinner with Friends, Ichigo-Ichie (cherish the moment) with Yoshiko, Hiroyuki, WSNF Trustee David Salama of Tavern on The Green, WSNF Young Trustee Andrew Meyer, and artist Kaoli Mashio from Dusseldorf. The dinner is on Wednesday, November 6, 2024, 18:30 - 20:30 with a special viewing of Suzusan's Fall Collection at 17:30. Suzusan Pop-up Show (Open to the Public) Wednesday and Thursday, November 6 and 7: 12:00 - 17:00 Friday, November 8: 10:00 - 17:00 LOCATION: Tavern on the Green in Central Park, Central Park West and W 67th St, New York, NY 10023 A limited number of tickets are available. Choose your preferred date. *Ticket Sales are Open to WSNF Members ONLY until October 5, 2024. Ticket Sales Open to the Public on October 6. Fellows Tickets are available for journalists, academic institutions, and museums. Fellows Ticket Application Form Visit our event page . Become a Member of WSNF Donate to WSNF Questions? Contact info(at)shibori(.)org www.shibori.org World Shibori Network Foundation (WSNF) is a non-profit, tax-exempt organization registered in the state of California under section 501 (c) (3) of the Internal Revenue Code of the United States. Proceeds from World Shibori Network Foundation (WSNF) programs are an important source of funding and help support WSNFs educational, exhibition, and public programs to preserve textile traditions throughout the world. Our Tax ID number is, # 88-3551186 .

1024360518887.summary: Welcome to WeedWork, a groundbreaking initiative by Popped.NYC, offering a unique blend of work and wellness on the Lower East Side. As NYC's first cannabis-friendly co-working membership club, WeedWork is designed for professionals seeking to infuse cannabis into their wellness routine without compromising their work-life balance. Why Choose WeedWork? Your New Cannabis-Friendly Office Space Flexibility and Freedom : At WeedWork, we redefine the conventional workspace. You dont need to be tied to a 9-5 job to enjoy our amenities. Our space is perfect for freelancers, entrepreneurs, and anyone who values flexibility in their work and wellness routine. Active Lifestyle Encouraged : Forget sitting at a desk all day. We promote an active lifestyle, encouraging members to move and stretch every 45 to 60 minutes. It's about keeping both mind and body agile. Networking and Community : Connect with like-minded professionals through our innovative networking opportunities. Our friendly 'flight attendants' are always ready to help you meet potential collaborators or new friends. Cannabis Culture Meets Comfort : As the green wave sweeps across New York, WeedWork offers a haven for cannabis enthusiasts. Whether you prefer smoking, vaping, or edibles, our space is designed to cater to your choice of relaxation while providing a productive environment. Exclusive Features of Our CBD Co-Working Space Music that Moves You : Immerse yourself in a diverse selection of music, from old-school hip-hop to house and pop. With DJ privileges, monthly members can personalize our shared Spotify playlist, ensuring the vibe is always right. Versatile Workspaces : Whether you're here to work on your laptop or unwind with a good book, our urban oasis offers the perfect setting. Experience the gritty charm of the East Village of the past, or contribute to our community-driven space with your own initiatives. Inclusive and Diverse : WeedWork prides itself on being an inclusive space for individuals from all industries and walks of life. We celebrate diversity and welcome everyone, from the creatively weird to the innovatively normal.

1031296063287.summary: The Center for Urban Science + Progress (CUSP) at NYU Tandon and Transit Techies welcome you to attend a talk on QueensLink by Noelle Hunter , Design and Communications Lead at QueensLink, and Andrew Lynch , Chief Design Officer at QueensLink. Their presentation will dive into the QueensLink project, which proposes converting an abandoned rail line in Queens into a subway extension, improving transit for underserved areas. It would reduce commute times, stimulate local economies, and integrate green space. The project aims to enhance transportation while promoting economic growth and environmental sustainability. 1013138302937.summary: Beginning with a short introduction to the history, legacy, and implications of mapmaking, participants will be invited to step outside of their preconceptions, drawing new neighborhood maps that decenter dominant - or even human - perspectives. We will examine an array of different mapmaking techniques across cultures and species, and participants will have the option to trace local topographic maps to use as foundations for later drawings. The group will then take a short walk through Mount Prospect Park, where we will observe the parks human and non-human users, mapping their experiences of the local landscape through drawing. Working across multiple scales and user groups, participants might examine nesting patterns of local birds, record point densities of fallen leaves, survey plant or animal life within a confined area, or imagine alternative landscape designs that prioritize accessibility, habitat restoration, or play.
1013138302937.description: Participants will examine an array of different mapmaking techniques across cultures and species and map experiences of the local landscape.
1013138302937.event_address: Stairs on Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn, NY 11238
1013138302937.title: Mapping a Living Earth

919631130467.summary: About the Conference The Northeast Conference on Public Administration (NECoPA) , the annual regional conference of the American Society for Public Administration (ASPA) in the Northeast, is intended to provide educational opportunities for scholars (faculty and students), practitioners (administrators and policymakers), and others interested in public service in a collaborative environment by educating all on current issues, research, and practice in public and nonprofit organizations. This conference will be NECoPAs 15th year of bringing together scholars and practitioners from the northeast region, the United States, and internationally. Conference Theme and Proposal Submission The theme, Building a Flexible Public Service through Innovation and Collaboration , recognizes the advancements in digital technology as well as the intersectoral and interdisciplinary collaborations in addressing wicked public service problems while advocating for and protecting our democracy. Public and nonprofit administration has been tasked with adapting and navigating public programs in this world to ensure they continue to be delivered in an effective, efficient, democratic, transparent, and equitable manner. We welcome proposals related to this theme in suggested topic areas: Innovation and Technology in Public Service. This track covers innovation and technology broadly defined to include innovative and technological (including Artificial Intelligence) approaches and advances in the public and nonprofit sectors. Financial Management and Budgeting. This track welcomes proposals that relate to financial management and budgeting practices and policies of public (local, state and federal) and nonprofit organizations. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Justice in Public Service. This track welcomes proposals that relate to all relevant areas of public and nonprofit organizations. Public Service Education. This track is designed to create a dialogue on comprehensive strategies for inspiring and preparing the next generation of public service leaders through the integration of professional skills development and experiential learning with deep academic inquiry into the critical issues that shape the nature of public service. Performance Management & Program Evaluation. This track welcomes proposals that relate to performance management of public and nonprofit organizations. Collaboration in Public Service. This track welcomes proposals that discuss the role of collaboration in solving public problems. Other Pressing Topics in Public and Nonprofit Research and Practice (e.g., challenges to democracy, elections, etc.) Using the above prompts as a guide, submit your individual proposal (250-word limit) or fully formed panel proposal or workshop (400-word limit) through the proposal submission portal . Proposals will be accepted on a rolling basis. Proposals should be submitted through this link . Proposals are due by August 19, 2024 , and notice of acceptance will be announced on or around September 16, 2024. Host and Format We are pleased to bring this years conference back to an in-person experience . The 2024 NECoPA conference is being hosted by Pace University in collaboration with Baruch College, CUNY and the New York Metropolitan ASPA Chapter at Pace Universitys campus in downtown Manhattan, New York. Please contact NEConferencePA@gmail.com for more information. Awards We will be recognizing Best Paper Awards for the following categories: students, academics and practitioners. If you would like to be considered for any of this awards please submit a full paper (no more than 30 pages) to NEConferencePA@gmail.com by August 19, 2024. We will also present the Marc Holzer Award to recognize a NECoPA member for sustained and exemplary service and outstanding contributions to the organization. A one-paragraph nomination should be sent to NEConferencePA@gmail.com by August 19, 2024. Sponsorship Opportunities We offer the following sponsorship opportunities. For more details, please visit https://northeastpublicadmin.org/ or NEConferencePA@gmail.com . Gold sponsor: $4,000 Silver sponsor: $2,500 Bronze sponsor: $1,000 Other amount: Flexible Publication opportunity Based on full paper submissions and presentations at the conference, individuals will be invited to submit an abbreviated version of their papers to be published in an edited book around this years conference theme. More details will be communicated post-conference. We are looking forward to seeing everyone in New York this fall!
919631130467.description: NECoPA 2024: Building a Flexible Public Service Through Innovation and Collaboration
919631130467.title: 2024 Northeast Conference on Public Administration (NECoPA)

999624914027.summary: Friday, October 25 8:00am-4:30pm eastern Wave Hill 4900 Independence Ave. Bronx, NY 10471 This will be a hybrid event with a virtual option for participation CEU's: This year's Ecological Plant Conference is approved for the following CEU's: 4 LA CES credits, 4 APLD credits, 2 MCA credits. Credits are available for both virtual and in-person attendees. This years Ecological Plant Conference at Wave Hill on Friday, October 25 will feature four incredible speakers, each with a unique perspective and stories to share about working with plants. The Ecological Plant Conference is always a deep dive into the world of plants in the built landscape and this year's program is sure to inspire you to learn more about the plants around you. Speakers include: Ethan Dropkin - Larry Weaner Landscape Associates Educated in Landscape Architecture and Horticulture at Cornell University, Ethan Dropkin has taken an inborn love of plants since childhood and followed that to a career in landscape design with a focus in native plants and landscapes at Larry Weaner Landscape Associates and lecturing on horticulture and plants at large. Ethan has a particular love of plants (and plant communities) that thrive in difficult conditions and how those plants and assemblages can be adapted to horticultural practice to solve some of our most difficult planting issues. When not designing or lecturing he is an avid contributor to citizen science projects like eBird and iNaturalist and is a loving father and husband. Tama Matsuoka Wong - Meadows and More Tama Matsuoka Wong is a forager, weed eater, wild farmer, and meadow doctor. She is the author of the backyard field guide and cookbook Foraged Flavor (Clarkson Potter June 2012), nominated for a James Beard award in 2013, followed by Scraps, Wilt & Weeds with Chef Mads Refslund (winner of IACP award for Food Matters) and now Into the Weeds: How to Garden Like a Forager . After graduating from Harvard Law School and serving more than 25 years as a financial services lawyer in Tokyo, New York, and Hong Kong, Tama returned with her family to Hunterdon County, New Jersey and rediscovered her passion for the natural world. In 2007, she was named Steward of the Year by the New Jersey Forest Service. Arden Pontasch - North Creek Nurseries Arden Pontasch is the Plant Trials Manager at North Creek Nurseries, a wholesale propagation nursery with a strong emphasis on Eastern US native plants and their cultivars. She represents the Pennsylvania Landscape & Nursery Association (PLNA) on the Invasive Species Council for the Pennsylvania Department of Agriculture and sits on the Government Relations Committee for PLNA. Arden holds a Bachelor of Arts in Environmental Studies from the University of Toledo, Ohio, and has dedicated herself to the Green Industry (with experience in both private and public sectors) for almost 20 years. Above all, Arden is passionate about connecting people with nature, which has led her on a path of exploring plants, human culture, and their role in shaping the world around us. Evan Abramson - Landscape Interactions Evan Abramson grew up amongst the museums and parks of New York City, where early exposure to ancient art, cultures, animals and plants left lasting impressions upon his abilities to create and organize images, color, light and form. Drawing on his diverse experience as a regional planner, landscape designer, farmer, community organizer, filmmaker and photojournalist, Evan designs landscapes and corridors that build biodiversity and resilience to a changing climate at the ecosystems level. As Founder and Principal of Landscape Interactions, he works closely with project partners along every step of the process, from conception through design, implementation and maintenance. Under his leadership, Landscape Interactions has been responsible for designing over 350 acres of installed habitat across the Northeast. He holds a Master of Science in Ecological Design from the Conway School, Certificates in Permaculture Design and Biodynamic Gardening, and is the author of numerous publications, including Pollinate Now , Farming for Biodiversity and Lincoln Pollinator Action Plan . Member pricing is available for current ELA members. To check your membership status and find your Subscription (Member) number, visit your member profile on the ELA website. Are you interested in sponsoring the Ecological Plant Conference? Contact ELA Executive Director Mark Richardson, mark@ecolandscaping.org, to learn about sponsorship opportunities and benefits. NOTE: Standard parking at Wave Hill is not available for symposium attendees. Limited handicap parking spaces are available for symposium attendees. There are many options for public transit, which can be found on Wave Hill's website here: https://www.wavehill.org/visit/getting-here. Shuttle service will run for attendees prior to registration and at the end of the day from both the Riverdale train station and the last stop on Subway #1.
999624914027.description: 2024 Ecological Plant Conference at Wave Hill
999624914027.venue_name: Wave Hill Public Garden & Cultural Center
999624914027.title: ELA Ecological Plant Conference
