1010904080317.summary: Accelerate use-inspired solutions to complex challenges Join us on November 7 for the NSF Convergence Accelerator Regional Expansion Event | Northeast New York City . As part of the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) Convergence Accelerators expansion to 10 regionally focused NSF Convergence Accelerators , NSF will host an in-person expansion event in New York City. The NSF Convergence Accelerator Northeast Regional Expansion Event in New York City will share with attendees how we plan to expand from a single national program to 10 regionally focused NSF Convergence Accelerators that aim to enhance and promote regional competitiveness in research and innovation. We welcome our colleagues, partners and stakeholders from academia, industry, nonprofits, government and other communities of practice to join us in New York City for this Northeast Regional Expansion Event. The Convergence Accelerator program builds on foundational research by bringing together researchers, practitioners and stakeholders from a wide array of sectors and domains to accelerate use-inspired solutions to complex challenges that benefit from multidisciplinary perspectives. These 10 NSF Regional Convergence Accelerators will harness the full geography of innovation throughout the U.S., increasing NSF's reach by engaging more researchers as well as NSF's impact by scaling the delivery of tangible solutions for all Americans.
1010904080317.description: The NSF Convergence Accelerator is continuing its program expansion with a Northeast Regional Expansion Event in New York City.
1010904080317.venue_name: The Westin New York at Times Square
1010904080317.title: NSF Convergence Accelerator Regional Expansion Event | Northeast New York

1038943065677.summary: In 2024-25, ID will host the Shapeshift Global Series , a series of 5 global events on the same theme: Responsible AI. Our New York City salon focuses on the future of media and information literacy, bringing together leaders working at the forefront of AI capabilities in media, publishing, and knowledge tools. This event will explore how AI is reshaping the way we produce and consume media, and how we can make this transition responsibly and ethically. Speakers Include: Liz Danzico , Vice President, Design, Microsoft AI Robin Kwong , Director of Product Management and Data Services, Yahoo News Jun Lee , GEMIC Consulting Anijo Mathew , Dean, Institute of Design at Illinois Tech Judd Morgenstern , Partners Resolute Albert Shum , Advisor to the Dean, ID and former CVP of Design, Microsoft Co-Hosted by Microsoft, Steelcase, and ID Alumni The Global Shapeshift Series shifts the current focus on AIfrom technology to real-world applications, from Silicon Valley to other parts of the world. By doing so, we can be intentional about the innovations we want, leapfrog legacy systems, and lead radical new implementations. For more, check out ID's 2024 report, Taking Responsibility in the Age of AI , which outlines five urgent challenges organizations face today.
1038943065677.description: Leaders at the center of moving AI capabilities into media and publishing explore how to make this transition responsibly.
1038943065677.venue_name: Steelcase WorkLife Center Showroom, New York City
1038943065677.title: Responsible AI: Media & Information Literacy [Shapeshift Global Series]

1028330041837.summary: Tuesday , November 19 6:00 to 7:30 PM Lila Acheson Wallace Auditorium The Asia Society 725 Park Avenue With Tim Rodgers Director, the Museum of Art and Design Annabelle Selldorf Founding Principal, Selldorf Architects, Pratt alumna (B. Arch. 85) Stellene Volandes Editor-in-Chief, Town and Country Moderated by Marc Rosen , cosmetics packaging designer and Pratt Trustee Emeritus Design Beyond Boundaries : Rethinking the Future Reinvention, Renewal, Restoration, and Recycling are all driving forces behind good design today. But what factors create visionary expression? In what ways do designers see new yet crucial and expansive opportunities to contribute to society through their craft? And what role and what responsibility does design play in meaningful human uplift? The idea that design plays an irreplaceable role in leading not only new experiences but laying paths for a better, more sustainable world is driving design thinking, design processes, and the use of technology to reach new levels of design innovation. Pratt Institutes 2024 Design Symposium will convene a distinguished panel of designers and industry leaders to explore the exciting ways in which design is pushing the boundaries and helping reimagine the future. Please join us for this special evening. Free and open to the public; reservations required. Supported by the Marc Rosen Education Fund. Additional funding by Juliana Terian, The Terian Foundation.
1028330041837.description: Join us at the Pratt Institute Design Symposium 2024, where we'll explore re-invention and imagination through design and its future!
1028330041837.title: Design Beyond Boundaries: Rethinking the Future

1021934522667.summary: Thursday, November 14, 8:00am-4:00pm eastern Delaware Center for Horticulture 1810 N Dupont Street Wilmington, DE 19806 This will be a hybrid event with a virtual option for participation CEU's: This conference has been approved for up to 3 LA CES credits. Additional CEU's are being sought. Delving into the meaning of our conference title, this conference features expert speakers on the subjects of designing, installing, maintaining, researching, and experiencing regenerative and/or resilient landscapes in the context of ecological functionality in the age of climate change. Speakers include: Kesha Braunskill USDA Forest Service Kesha Braunskill serves as an Urban and Community Forestry Specialist with the USDA Forest Service. In her role, Kesha works closely with grant recipients in the mid-Atlantic states with community forestry related projects. Prior to working for the USFS, Kesha served as the State Program Coordinator for the Delaware Forest Services Urban and Community Forestry program. Keshas professional background includes ecology, wildlife, and academia. Kesha continues to stay active outside of work as a beadwork artist and an advocate of black and indigenous history, culture, and environment. Kelly Gutshall Land Studies, Inc. Kelly Gutshall, RLA, ASLA is president of LandStudies, Inc., an ecological restoration design/build firm providing design, engineering, construction, and maintenance services throughout the mid-Atlantic region. Kelly and her team of 45 professionals including Landscape Architects, Engineers, Scientists and Restoration Ecologists, have pioneered solutions that utilize floodplain restoration and functional natural landscapes to solve some of the most pressing water resource and bio-diversity issues of our time. She particularly enjoys working collaboratively with community leaders at the local and state levels to help change perceptions about the landscape from purely aesthetic, to one of working, functional environments. Among other awards, in 2019, she was recognized by PennFuture with a Lifetime Achievement in Conservation for her contributions to the environment, community, water quality, land protection and conservation. Eva Monheim Verdant Earth Educators Eva Monheim is a speaker and an award-winning educator. She is a faculty member at Longwood Gardens for the Professional Horticulture Program and Continuing Education Department. She was an assistant professor at Temple University where she taught numerous subjects to undergraduate and graduate students in horticulture and landscape architecture. Monheims other endeavors in the green industry are the award-winning The Plant a Trillion Trees Podcast which is heard in over 110 countries. She is the author of Shrubs & Hedges: Discover, Grow, and Care for the Worlds Most Popular Plants , which was nominated by The Council on Botanical & Horticultural Libraries for outstanding contributions to the literature of horticulture. Monheim is co-principal of Verdant Earth Educators, LLC (VEE) a company that writes educational documents and standards, SOPs, landscape management plans, and trains professionals in the green industry. Adam Welz Author, The End of Eden: Wild Nature in the Age of Climate Change Adam Welz is a South African writer, nature conservation consultant, photographer and filmmaker. He's the author of The End of Eden: Wild Nature in the Age of Climate Breakdown (Bloomsbury 2023), a groundbreaking book that explores the impacts of climate change on wild species and natural ecosystems. Welz was born and raised in Pretoria, South Africa, and has lived, worked and travelled on six continents, including extended periods in the United States. He consults on conservation projects and is an experienced birder and keen all-round naturalist. His writing focuses on wildlife, nature conservation and climate change, and has appeared in numerous publications worldwide including The Guardian, The Atlantic and Yale Environment 360. He's directed, shot, researched and scripted a number of movies (mostly documentaries) and is seldom far from a stills camera or two. He lives in Cape Town with his wife, Sarah, and their rambunctious triplet daughters. Member pricing is available for current ELA members. To check your membership status and find your Subscription (Member) number, visit your member profile on the ELA website. Are you interested in sponsoring the Regenerative Solutions for Resilient Landscapes Conference? Contact ELA Executive Director Mark Richardson, mark@ecolandscaping.org, to learn about sponsorship opportunities and benefits.
1021934522667.description: ELA Regenerative Solutions for Resilient Landscapes Conference
1021934522667.title: ELA Regenerative Solutions for Resilient Landscapes Conference

1028488395477.summary: Join us for an unforgettable evening of empowerment, beauty, and celebration at Check Your Canns 2! This special event is dedicated to honoring and uplifting breast cancer survivors through transformative makeovers that celebrate their strength and resilience. Our incredible team of professional volunteers will give each of our brave survivors, whom we proudly call our Pinkettes, a stunning Rosie the Riveter meets Pinup Girl makeover. Witness the magic as these inspiring women see themselves for the first time in their new looks, surrounded by a supportive and cheering audience. It's a heartwarming moment that beautifully captures the essence of empowerment and self-love. The evening will be filled with lively entertainment, featuring the Canny Brothers Band, who will keep the energy high with their fantastic music. Enjoy delicious food, exciting raffle prizes, and the company of a community coming together for a meaningful cause. All proceeds from Check Your Canns 2 will go towards supporting the Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Brooklyn team, helping to fund research, provide support, and raise awareness in the fight against breast cancer. Were excited to invite you to dress up and celebrate the spirit of strength, unity, and vintage charm of Check Your Canns 2! Get ready to channel your inner Rosie the Riveter and step back in time with us for a spectacular night and empower our PINKETTES! Here are some suggestions on how you can dress up for Check Your Canns 2! Coveralls or Overalls: Instead of the traditional blue, opt for a pink version. You can find pink coveralls or overalls in various shades to suit your preference. Pink Bandana or Headscarf: The classic Rosie look features a polka-dot bandana, usually red. For your pink version, find a pink bandana with white polka dots or a solid pink scarf to tie around your head. Rolled-Up Sleeves: Roll up the sleeves of your coveralls or overalls to highlight the working woman aesthetic. Here are some Makeup and Hair suggestions to dress up! Victory Rolls: This classic 1940s hairstyle can be adapted to match the pink theme. You can go for a classic roll and add some temporary pink hair chalk. Bold Makeup: Go for a bold red or pink lipstick, winged eyeliner, and a touch of blush to capture the pinup girl essence. Practice Attitude and Poses for our Photo Opportunity created by The Boho Barn Rosie the Riveter is all about strength and confidence. Practice classic Rosie poses, like flexing your arm muscles. Group Coordination supporting your Pinkette receiving a makeover! Group Photo Ops: Plan some group poses that highlight your unity and strength, much like a team of Rosies In coordinating outfits. Maybe create shirts showing your support to one of our Pinkettes receiving a makeover. Emotional reveal moment for our Pinkette models Live music by the Canny Brothers Band Sound by Fred the Soundguy Decor by The Boho Barn Delicious food and drinks donated by our community here in Staten Island Exciting raffle prizes donated by our community of friends from all over
1028488395477.description: Join us for a fun night of coming together as a community, watching our Pinkettes be transformed, & taking a stand against breast cancer!
1028488395477.title: Check Your Canns 2! A Night to LIFT our Girls & Take a Stand Against Cancer

995423256757.summary: The Manhattan Chapter of The Order of AHEPA, Delphi 25, invites you to join them for a special Gala event at exquisite venue of 583 Park Avenue in honor of our honorable Chapter member and benefactor Thomas Tripodianos, ESQ. Join us for this wonderful event comprised of a rich cocktail hour, a three-course plated dinner, and unlimited prime liquor open-bar all night long ! BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE Brother Thomas S. Tripodianos is the Managing Partner at Welby, Brady & Greenblatt, LLP, where he plays a pivotal role in all facets of construction, labor, and employment law. His firm serves a diverse clientele, including buyers, sellers, lenders, developers, general contractors, construction managers, owners, architects, engineers, subcontractors, suppliers, sureties, and other key entities, offering indispensable legal services across the industry. As a first-generation Greek American, Mr. Tripodianos developed a keen interest in real estate and construction law from his early experience managing properties for his familys business in Queens. He is a respected mentor for emerging attorneys, providing valuable leadership and insights. Additionally, he is skilled in Alternative Dispute Resolution. Mr. Tripodianos is actively involved with several prestigious organizations: New York Building Congress: He contributes to numerous committees, including Construction Law, Education, Arts & Culture, Energy & Sustainability, Government Affairs, Planning, Growth & Sustainability, Public Building & Procurement, and Transportation & Infrastructure. Past President: Construction Financial Manager Association, New York City Chapter. Past President: Hudson Valley Builders and Remodelers Association; served as Education Committee Chair, Grievance Committee Chair, and Membership Committee Member. New York State Builders Association: Secretary, Executive Board Member, and Chairman of the Legal Defense Fund. Lorman Faculty Member. Frequent speaker at various national and local professional and trade organizations such as Lorman, the International Risk Management Institute and Building Realty Institute American Hellenic Educational Progressive Association (AHEPA): Delphi Chapter 25. Parish Council Member: Assumption of the Theotokos Greek Orthodox Church, Danbury, CT. Free and Accepted Masons. Mr. Tripodianos has earned notable recognition for his professional excellence, including: Martindale-Hubbell's Preeminent AV Rating Super Lawyer Top Attorneys in New York Metro/Westchester Above all, Thomas is a dedicated family man. He is the son of Greek immigrants, with his father hailing from Crete and his mother from Karpenissi. Thomas is married to Kleanthi also the daughter of Greek immigrants whose father is from Athens and mother is from Crete. She is a Greek school teacher, active member of the Philoptochos Society and Civic Engagement Chairperson of the Womens Club of Danbury New Fairfield. Together, they have two remarkable children: Angelica, a senior and Army ROTC cadet at Penn State University, who will commission as a Second Lieutenant in the U.S. Army upon graduation furthering her studies in Physician Assistant School, and Steven, a junior and Army ROTC cadet at Virginia Tech, who is also set to become a Second Lieutenant in the U.S. Army upon graduation and will continue onto Law School to join the Judge Advocate General (JAG) branch of the U.S. Army. Join us for this wonderful event comprised of a rich cocktail hour, a three-course plated dinner, and unlimited prime liquor open-bar all night long! This Annual Gala event is always well attended by the Leadership of the AHEPA Supreme and District Lodges. Seating is limited so secure your tickets now ! Friday, November 22nd, 2024 583 Park Avenue The AHEPA Delphi Chapter # 25 is the first AHEPA Chapter organized in New York State, founded in 1923, having a glorious history with many esteemed past and current members including the late Franklin D. Roosevelt, President of the USA. Currently this AHEPA Chapter is one of the most vibrant Chapters of The Order of AHEPA ; following a dynamic revitalization our Manhattan-based Chapter has grown to be the largest Chapter in the entire global AHEPA domain! For any further information please visit www.AHEPA25.org or contact via email to: ahepa25.delphinyc@gmail.com NOTE: A portion of the net proceeds from this event will benefit the AHEPA Empire State District Six Sholarships, Inc. a New York State -based 501(c)(3) non-profit organization created to support young professionals with Scholarships in their early educational journey.

1044223078337.summary: NEW YORK SCHOOL OF THE ARTS is pleased to announce our 20204 Open House and Faculty Exhibition reception. The evening will feature an exhibition of works by our Faculty Members, an Open Studio Night for our Arts Intensive Students and HUB Members as well as free drop-in sessions for Open sketching from a live model & a sculpture free form session. This is an invitation to the public to learn about the school, meet the Faculty Members, and see the artistic creative energy within our community. This is a place for experimentation, research, conversation, philosophical debate and a place to encounter others, said Executive Director, Maurizio Pellegrin. New York School of the Arts is a living, learning community, dedicated to exploring art in 360 degrees. On the 6th floor, our HUB Center for the Arts holds dedicated studio space for the Arts Intensive Program and 12 personal studios for The HUB Lab Members. Devoted to contemporary artistic practices, students, faculty and art professionals use these spaces to work to create relevant visions about art in the world of tomorrow. Located in a 1915 industrial loft building on 62nd Street, New York School of the Arts is a dynamic and innovative school and arts center based on learning the heritage of the classic discipline while addressing and incorporating the exploration of new media. It is the synthesis of what artists are looking for, a unique school on a small scale, with a sense of community and a structure that allows for dialogue with the other institutions in the city. It has been created to fulfill the expectations of the transformed contemporary art world, said Pellegrin. New York School of the Arts offers at any level a wide spectrum of classes, workshops and programs across multiple fine arts disciplines. We foster creative learning through the use of the atelier methodology, critical and conceptual instruction and demonstrations by professional artists.
1044223078337.description: Join our art community for the Faculty Exhibition reception & Open House. The event will include open studios and free demos

1044223078337.venue_name: New York School of the Arts
1044223078337.title: Open House & Faculty Exhibition Reception

1021637103077.summary: Join us for an evening steeped in tradition and honor at the Saint Barbara's Day Ball , hosted by the 1st Battalion, 258th Field Artillery. The evening will feature a formal dinner, dancing, and a special live performance by the 42nd Infantry Division Band. The Saint Barbara's Day Ball is a time-honored celebration within the Field Artillery community, dedicated to recognizing the contributions and achievements of our soldiers and honoring the patron saint of artillerymen, Saint Barbara. Whether you're an active servicemember, a veteran, family, or a friend of the unit, this is a night you won't want to miss. Come dressed in your finest attire, enjoy great food and entertainment, and be a part of this special tradition. Date & Time: Saturday, December 14th, 2024 at 1800hrs Venue: Scavello's on the Island Awards Presentation: During this evening, we will recognize outstanding individuals with several prestigious awards: Ancient Order of Saint Barbara: Reserved for those with long-term dedication to the Field Artillery, embodying the spirit and commitment epitomized by Saint Barbara. Honorable Order of Saint Barbara: Recognizes individuals who have demonstrated the highest standards of integrity, competence, and selflessness in service to the Field Artillery. Esteemed Artillery Order of Molly Pitcher: Honor those who have mentored other spouses and volunteers, showing a life-long commitment to the Field Artillery Community. Artillery Order of Molly Pitcher: Recognizes significant voluntary contributions to the improvement of the Field Artillery Community. RSVP: On this site or directly to CPT Kyle Davis at (518) 948-1752 or kyle.j.davis38.mil@army.mil for offline options. No Later Than 15 Nov 2024. Tickets will not be sold at the door. Dress Code: Army Service Uniform, Army Mess Uniform, or Army Green Service Uniform for Soldiers of the 1-258 FA. "Black Tie" or formal wear for all civilian guests. FAQs Can I pay by Venmo, Apple Pay, or other Offline Payment Option? Yes. Please contact CPT Kyle Davis at (518) 948-1752 or kyle.j.davis38.mil@army.mil for mobile / offline payment options and processing. There is no change in Ticket deadlines. What can I wear to the event? - Army Service Uniform, Civilian Black Tie" - Army Mess Uniform - Army Green Service Uniform - Formal wear Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? - No. Once registered your name will be on the entrance roster to the event What is The Tradition of Saint Barbara's Day? The Order of Saint Barbara is a military honor society of the US for both the US Army and the US Marine Corps Field Artillery. On this occasion The Honorable Order recognizes those individuals within 1-258 Field Artillery Battalion who have demonstrated the highest standards of integrity and moral character, displayed an outstanding degree of competence and served the United States Army Field Artillery Branch with selflessness. They have significantly contributed to the promotion of the Field Artillery in ways that stand out in the eyes of their seniors, subordinates, and peers alike. They have established a standard of excellence for aspiring Redlegs. More than any other event in the life of Field Artillery soldiers, Saint Barbara's Day offers an opportunity to enhance professional commitment and underscore lofty standards of excellence and to create an atmosphere of camaraderie among Field Artillery soldiers within 1-258 Field Artillery Battalion , their families, and cohesion within the units.
1021637103077.description: Join us for the 2024 Saint Barbara's Day Ball on Dec 14th! Formal dinner, dancing and a live performance by the 42nd Infantry Division Band.
1021637103077.event_address: 101 City Island Avenue, The Bronx, NY 10464
1021637103077.title: 1-258 FA Saint Barbara's Ball 2024

1043270228337.summary: Welcome to the "Building The Nuclear Texas Network: Panel & Happy Hour" event series. Join us on November 7th in Austin for networking and discussions about the future of nuclear in Texas. Our panel of experts will share insights and answer your questions on economics, development, and policy around nuclear energy. Please feel free to stick around afterward for a happy hour to mingle and make new connections. This incredible event is brought to you by a partnership between the Texas Nuclear Alliance and the American Conservation Coalition(ACC). This is one of five Happy hour and panel events around nuclear energy in Texas. This Austin Event is sponsored by 8VC, an Austin based Venture fund. Read below to learn more about the host organizations and sponser. The American Conservation Coalition (ACC) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to mobilizing young people around environmental action through common-sense, pro-innovation, and limited-government principles. ACC was founded in 2017 by a group of young conservatives who wanted to fill the ideological gap in the environmental movement that was preventing effective, durable action. You can learn more about ACC at acc.eco The Texas Nuclear Alliance is the only industry association in Texas dedicated to the advancement of nuclear technology in the state. TNA was formed with a singular mission: to make Texas the Nuclear Capital of the World. Formed in 2022 in the aftermath of Winter Storm Uri, TNA is based on the fundamental premise that if Texas and the world want low-carbon, reliable energy, it can no longer turn its back on nuclear energy. Nuclear is clean, safe, reliable, and secure. TNA is hosting the inaugural Texas Nuclear Summit this November in Austin, TX. More information regarding tickets, sponsorship, and speakers can be found at www.nucleartexas.com . At 8VC, we partner with elite founders to build transformational technologies that create long-term economic and societal value.We are investors who never stopped being engineers, operators, policymakers, philosophers, and entrepreneurs. We are equally fervent realists and optimists, with an irreverence for convention and a reverence for wisdom. learn more at https://www.8vc.com/
1043270228337.description: Join us for Building the Nuclear Texas Network as we hold our fifth event of the series in Austin. Enjoy our networking social and panel.
1043270228337.title: Building the Nuclear Texas Network: Panel and Happy Hour | Austin

1028930798717.summary: Join the Murder of Crows book club for a lively discussion of FIRST LIE WINS by Ashley Elston. ABOUT THE BOOK: This fast-paced read has everything you could want in a thriller: secret identities, a mysterious boss and a cat & mouse game that kept me guessing the whole way through. Reese Witherspoon Evie Porter has everything a nice, Southern girl could want: a perfect, doting boyfriend, a house with a white picket fence and a garden, a fancy group of friends. The only catch: Evie Porter doesnt exist. The identity comes first: Evie Porter. Once shes given a name and location by her mysterious boss Mr. Smith, she learns everything there is to know about the town and the people in it. Then the mark: Ryan Sumner. The last piece of the puzzle is the job. Evie isnt privy to Mr. Smiths real identity, but she knows this job will be different. Ryan has gotten under her skin, and shes starting to envision a different sort of life for herself. But Evie cant make any mistakes--especially after what happened last time. Because the one thing shes worked her entire life to keep clean, the one identity she could always go back toher real identityjust walked right into this town. Evie Porter must stay one step ahead of her past while making sure theres still a future in front of her. The stakes couldn't be higher--but then, Evie has always liked a challenge... _________________________________________________________________________________________________ **The Lark & Owl Book Club policy** In order to balance the continued interest in our book clubs with the frequent no-shows, we have moved to a $5.00 fee for all book club events. At the book club meeting, all registered attendees will be given a $5.00 voucher to be used towards the next book club book, or a future purchase. Any individuals who register but do not attend will have 1 week from the event date to pick up their voucher from the bookstore. If the voucher is not claimed, it will be considered forfeited. Please be mindful of this policy as you are registering!
1028930798717.description: Mystery & True Crime Book Club Discussion Group
1028930798717.title: Murder of Crows Book Club

1002569601667.summary: A gathering of women, for women Our Sacred Womens Circle welcomes all ages and brings together the generations. These sacred gatherings give women a safe space to connect, share, celebrate, and empower. When we participate in a womens circle, we carry on the tradition of our female ancestors by forming a sacred community guided by the feminine energy to allow each woman to feel safe, held, heard without judgment, connected, and empowered. Why join? How often do we have space to speak without being interrupted? How often do we have permission to just be quiet and listen? How often do we get the opportunity to share our burdens without being told what we "should" do to fix it? How often are we able to share our happiness and triumphs without being viewed as cocky or conceited? How often do we take the time to step away from our families and responsibilities to take care of ourselves & fill our own cups? When we sit in a womens circle, we connect and support sisterhood in a safe space. Our Sacred Womens Circle gives each woman a chance to speak their truth without judgment. When we allow ourselves to be vulnerable with supportive, empowering women, it releases the weight of our burdens. We shed light on our fears, thus, diminishing their power. We talk through our stressors and into creative solutions. We can then step beyond the wall of fear, and into the freedom of our strength. It's a place to build community. Society has often found ways to break apart the sacred bonds between women. A womens circle reminds sisters to treat each other as allies, rather than competition. To look at each other and see the unique wisdom & gifts we each carry in our own experiences, our own traumas, our own lives. We allow ourselves to be open, vulnerable, authentic, raw, thus allowing the women surrounding us to do the same. We offer a touch point. A solid rock to come back to for stability and support. We laugh, share our joy, and celebrate each other's wins as a collective. We hold space for each other in times of need and we embrace one another without question. It is a moment for self-care. Women play essential roles in society. They are mothers, wives, aunts, sisters, daughters, partners, friends. They uphold positions of power & guide future generations of females to pursue their dreams. They are the queens of multi-tasking, leading both their families and their communities simultaneously. Often our busy lives get in the way of spending precious time on self-care. Our Sacred Womens Circle is a moment for self-love. It gives us permission to take time to nurture ourselves. A chance to pause, take a moment, and ask ourselves, "What do I need?" Being a part of a circle of women offers a time to rest, to connect with sisters, and focus on physical, spiritual, and mental wellbeing. Its a time to celebrate the divine feminine, to encourage originality and uniqueness in our sisters, and let your authentic Self shine!
1002569601667.description: A gathering of women, for women. These sacred gatherings give women a safe space to connect, share, celebrate, & empower.
1002569601667.title: Sacred Women's Circle - DFW

1047624752837.summary: Talking about death wont kill you, so come along to a death cafe! All are welcome at our discussion circle on death (and life). We will be in the private Meeting Room -- there will be a small paper sign with the Death Cafe logo on the door. We are now permitted to bring food into our meeting space in the library! There will be some light snacks available, and feel free to bring your own lunch or something to share if you wish. If more than 20 folks are in attendance and the Houston weather cooperates, anyone who wishes to will have the opportunity to break off into a smaller discussion group outside! Feel free to bring picnic blankets or lawn chairs if you think you might want to be outside rather than in. Emphasis that going outside is optional -- there will still be a discussion circle meeting inside. How to find us Enter through the library door. Continue straight, past the checkout desk. If you turn left, the meeting room door is immediately opposite the checkout desk. Any difficulty, ask the library staff how to find the Death Cafe! **************************************************************************** Death Caf Houston is part of the larger international social franchise movement of Death Cafs. We welcome all, members old and new. We meet monthly, typically the first Saturday around lunchtime. Each month has a new group of people and different energy, and the conversation uniquely evolves due to the dialogues being group-led. What is a Death Caf? A Death Caf is a group-directed discussion of death with no preset agenda, objectives or themes. It is a discussion group rather than a grief support or counselling session, and not affiliated with any specific faith or belief system. At a Death Caf people, often strangers, gather to eat treats and discuss death. Our objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'. To learn more about the Death Caf model click here
1047624752837.description: Talking about death wont kill you... so come along to a Death Caf! What in the world is a Death Caf? https://deathcafe.com/what/
1047624752837.title: Central Houston's Monthly Death Caf talk about death, dying, and life

1034569574447.summary: DALLAS JOB FAIR Tuesday, November 19, 2024 10:00am to 12:30pm Radisson Hotel Dallas North-Addison 4960 Arapaho Road Addison, TX 75001 Job seekers attend at no cost. Plan to attend and meet face-to-face with several of the Dallas areas finest employers. All of the companies at our job fairs have open positions they are seeking to fill. Tips for Success: Pre-registerReceive notifications of any updates or changes to the event, and receive information about upcoming events in your area. Dress professionallyFirst impressions go a long way. Bring multiple copies of your resume. Arrive any time between 10AM and 12:30PMPlan to spend 45 minutes to 1 hour at the event. Bring a friendAll job seekers are welcome. Prepare a brief but effective brag to let the people you meet with get to know you. Keep an open mindMeet with as many of the companies as you can; you may be pleasantly surprised at what you find. Remember, the best way to be considered for a position is to meet the hiring managers in person. Plan to attend this event! EMPLOYERS INTERESTED IN ATTENDING THIS JOB FAIR Employers - call (815) 308-5426 to register or to find out more about participating in this recruiting event. Or visit catalystcareergroup.com . One of our staff will send you the information you need to register and participate. 490288755867.summary: * This event is FREE for all job seekers & new recruiters. The event is conducted on the First Friday of Every Month, 11 am - 2 pm in your local timezone! FAQ: Q: What is the CareerClub Virtual job fair ? A: CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month, from 11 am to 2 pm, in your local city. It is a global virtual job fair for effective hiring among local professionals and recruiters and to promote healthy professional networking. CareerClub Virtual job fair, started as a small project to take the anxiety away from recruiters and professionals by making it available every month, and delivering it virtually, has now been deemed an industry standard and has encouraged several other organizations to join us and make their job fair monthly. Few even took it to the next level and joined us by taking their job fair globally through our platform. CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month from the convenience of their home, with no travel, no dressing formals, and no anxiety-led career event. A community-driven job fair where professionals, recruiters, and service providers come together to promote happy and healthy hiring. Q: Why should I attend the #CareerClub #Virtual jobfair? A: This global event is attended by thousands of recruiters to connect with 100s of thousands of seekers. This community-led event is where professionals spread the word and invite communities to job fairs. Some benefits: 1. Connect with local/global talent and opportunities 2. Collaborate with other professionals and never grow alone 3. Get access to resources to support long-lasting career growth Have more questions? Visit Event FAQ/Reachout Page at: https://jobfair.nwlb.app Q: Where is the event conducted? A: This is a virtual event, which means no travel is required. The event is conducted over your favorite internet browser. All you need is the following: Email(sent 24-78hours before) confirming you are assigned a room. An ability to chat, and if there is a common interest, go to a video/audio session( virtual rooms are provided ). A well-lit and quiet room where you could have a good session. Q: Is there a dress code? A: If you have received a note about your confirmed room, you would be encouraged to attend with respectable, semi-formal, and comfortable clothing. Q: Who could attend the event? A: This event is designed to help professionals [who are looking for work or exploring the market], recruiters [who are on the lookout for talent for their open roles], and service providers [who could assist professionals with their pursuit of a successful career]. Q: Which companies are attending? A: Amazon, Apple, CVS Health, United Health Group, Microsoft, Walgreens Boots Alliance, Kroger, The Home Depot, Verizon, Ford, General Motors, Anthem, Comcast, Bank of America, Target, UPS, Procter & Gamble, PepsiCo, FedEx, Disney, Albertsons, Prudential, Sysco, Best Buy, Allstate, AIG, Progressive, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Caterpillar, Dow, VA, Northrop Grumman, USAA, Dollar General, TJX Companies, Walmart ... and 8000 other businesses trust the platform for their recruiting. Q: Is this ticket enough, or do I need anything else to join the event? A: Participation is simple and effective: 1. Signup/register & RSVP with the platform at https://jobfaircc.nwlb.app 2. Stay on your emails for the next steps to attend. Q: What are the system requirements for attending the event? A: All you need to attend the event: Computer or Mobile Phone [No App is required] Broadband access [we advise 1.5 Mbps minimum for the best experience] A webcam(in case of a video call) Q: Which industries are visiting this event? A: This is a global event, and our communities are a mix of several industries, some of them include: Advertising, Aerospace, Agriculture and Agribusiness, Air pollution, Arms, Automotive, Broadcasting, Chemical, Computer, Construction, Creative, Defense, Education, Electric power, Electronics, Energy, Entertainment, Fashion, Film, Financial services, Fishing, Floral, Food, Healthcare, Horticulture, Hospitality, Industrial robot, Information, Insurance, Internet, Leisure, Low technology, Machine tooling, Machining, Manufacturing, Market research, Mass media, Mass production, Materials science, Meatpacking, Mining, Music, News media, Occupational injury, Occupational noise, Oil shale, Petroleum, Pharmaceutical, Pricing, Professional Services, Publishing, Pulp and paper, Raw material, Real estate, Robber baron (industrialist), Semiconductor, Services, Shipbuilding, Software, Sport, Steel, Telecommunications, Textile, Tobacco, Trade association, Transport, Video game, Water, Wood, etc. Q: Who are the people behind this event? A: #NoWorkerLeftBehind *, a global non-profit, is behind this event to democratize healthy career development for all, using technology to assist the global workforce to stay closer to their aspirational success through a healthy network, adequate knowledge and more opportunities. * NoWorkerLeftBehind is always on the lookout for professionals/organizations who want to actively work to help create a more equitable and just workforce that provides opportunities to everyone and creates an ecosystem of mutual growth and success. Interested in assisting us? Signup our volunteer list at https://one.tao.ai/nwlbvol Keywords: CareerFair, JobFair, JobFair, JobExpo, CareerExpo, Career Fair, Job Fair, Career Expo, Job Expo, Recruiter Event, Diversity, Equality, Equal Opportunity, Equal Opportunity, #jobsforall, #community, #employment, #skilled, #virtual, #online, community #Virtual #ONL

944584737377.summary: Introducing the third annual Texas Hemp Summit a B2B event produced by the Texas Hemp Coalition that will focus on the business side of the Texas hemp industry through educational discussions related to farming, processing, cannabinoids, fiber, and retail topics concerning Texas hemp operators. The Summit will be held at Texas A&M University at the AgriLife Center on November 1-2, 2024. The event will begin with a Welcome Reception on November 1st at 6pm which will be held at the AgriLife Center. See our schedule which is subject to change as we finalize our speakers. Visit our Texas Hemp Summit webpage for more information. 948198275567.summary: The seasons come and go, often without much notice from us. They blend into our daily routines, month after month, year after year. Yet, the seasons impact us physically, mentally, and spiritually. Each season carries its own emotions and significance. Historically, people aligned their activities with the seasons: spring and summer were for work and growth, fall for harvesting and preparing for the harsh winter, and winter for illness, isolation, and rest. The seasons remind us of the cycles we all endure. All supplies provided.
948198275567.description: This will be a creative multimedia event where we explore the four seasons, connecting intuitively and mindfully to each season .
948198275567.title: Creative Circle

1002627936147.summary: We know that as a single mom, you can often feel like you're on an island with very little help or community. Kingdom Life Women's Single Moms Group is a place where you can meet and form community with people that understand your struggles, lift you up when you are down, and encourage you when you don't feel like you're enough. We provide dinner for both you and your kiddos while you kick back and enjoy some community with single Mamas just like you who are seeking a closer relationship with God And more abundant life! (We are about relationship with God, NOT what religion you are!) We meet every two weeks at our beautiful venue, SheSpace, created by women for women! We think you are going to love it! There is no dress code for our event. If you're feeling yoga pants, then wear your yoga pants! We promise not to judge! Unless they're lime green. And then we will probably judge! You MUST RSVP For this event so that we have an accurate headcount for food and childcare! We can't wait to meet you and introduce you to your new best friends!!
1002627936147.description: CALLING ALL HOUSTON AREA CHRISTIAN SINGLE MOMS!!! You have found your Tribe! Come join us for a night of food, fun, giveaways & Community!!
1002627936147.title: Christian Single Moms Group

968652233907.summary: Out in Tech Houston provides an inclusive networking space for LGBTQ+ people and allies working in tech. About this event Join our relaxed, social-mixer event, hosted on the second Thursday of every month. This is the first year we are hosting our monthly mixer at The Ion, and we hope to have many more! Parking and getting there is tricky, so we've provided detailed information below. NOTE: Please be aware that we've recently lost one of our Leadership Team members and will be using our September Mixer as a time to celebrate his life and accomplishments in our community. About Out in Tech We are a non-profit that unites the LGBTQ+ tech community around the world. We do this by creating opportunities for our 40,000 members worldwide to advance their careers, grow their networks, and leverage tech for social change. We envision a tech industry where LGBTQ+ people are empowered, well-represented, and have full agency, from intern to CEO. We're looking forward to meeting you! RSVP and save the date in your calendars for an evening you cannot miss. ------- Out in Tech is the worlds largest non-profit community of LGBTQ+ tech leaders. Connect with 20k LGBTQ+ tech professionals in our Slack channel . Each local chapter (and many virtual ones) provides opportunities for folks to engage with us and each other. Our events educate and inspire with panels, career events, and more. If you have felt inspired and supported by these events, please consider supporting our work by making a donation to Out in Tech . Note: Out in Tech's Code of Conduc t applies to all our spaces, online and IRL. Photographs may be taken at this event. Please notify someone at check-in if you prefer not to be photographed. Need to reach out to OIT staff? Email houston@outintech.com (we promise we check it) ------- Getting to The Ion Second Draught is located on the first floor of The Ion. Getting to the building can be a bit tricky, so we've laid out some important details to keep in mind as you plan your arrival. You can also visit https://iondistrict.com/visit/getting-here/ for more information. Uber/Lyft/Rideshare Enter 4201 Main Street, Houston, TX 77002 into the destination address field in your rideshare app. However, you won't be dropped off and enter the building on Main Street. Instead, you'll enter the building at the east entrance, on Fannin Street. This is because the Metro light rail Red line runs along Main Street, and for safety, most rideshare apps direct the driver to drop passengers off on the other side of the building on Fannin Street. (See the map below.) Driving and Parking There are several parking options at The Ion. Red parking lot: This is a surface lot and is the best option because parking is free for the first 3 hours. (And the event is only scheduled for 1.5, so you're in the clear.) Enter 4203 Fannin Street, Houston, TX 77004 into your GPS for directions to the Red parking lot. There are no parking attendants, and the system does not issue physical tickets or receipts for parking. Simply drive in; the gate will open automatically, or prompt payment upon exit. The system captures images of vehicles upon entry and exit to manage access and payments. Please note that only debit and credit card payments are accepted. Yellow parking lot : This is also a surface lot and adheres to the same policies as the Red parking lot. However, we were advised that they often fill up quickly because they also offer valet service. Valet service is only $5 (not bad), and if you wish to park in the Yellow parking lot, enter 4200 Fannin Street, Houston, TX 77004 into your GPS. Pink parking lot (The Ion District Parking Garage): This is covered parking in a deck with elevators. This is not advised because parking is only free for 2 hours and it's a bit of a walk from the main Ion building. If you must have covered parking and don't mind walking, enter 4111 Fannin Street, Houston, TX 77004 into your GPS. Green parking lot: This is the surface parking lot for Greentown Labs, one block away from The Ion. Please do not park in this lot, even if the gates are open. Public Transit Take the Red Line Metrorail light rail and get off at the Wheeler station , located one block south at 4590 Main Street, Houston TX 77002. Trains run every 6 minutes.
968652233907.description: Out in Tech has arrived in Houston to provide an inclusive networking space for LGBTQ+ people and allies working in tech.
968652233907.title: Out in Tech Houston | Monthly Mixer

800085375897.summary: What we're about: Our Campaign: With the success of empowering 2 million families from 2017, we continue forward with a goal of financially educating 30 million people by 2030. Our Mission: To build and protect wealth for families. We want to help people move from financial insecurity to financial success, freedom and independence. Our Vision: To build a new industry to help solve the consumer's dilemma: lack of understanding planning and support. You can learn the habits of successful people. Financial success and financial independence through 6 Free Personal Finance Workshops and a complementary Personal Financial Strategy. WORKSHOPS: Workshop No. 01 Building Savings and Wealth You will walk out of this workshop with :- 1) A practical Financial Goal for you and your family so that you can be certain even in uncertain conditions. 2) You will have the right mindset to achieve your goal. 3)You will discover Wealth Formula which changed over 1.5 Million people so far to become Financially Independent. 4) You will have a clear understanding of the Time & Inflation effect on your hard earned money. Workshop No. 02 Increase Cash Flow And Manage Debt You will walk out of this workshop with :- 1) Discover $100 -$250 that you didnt know you had in your pocket. 2) Figure out where your money is going and how you can control your Cash Flow And Build a REAL Workable Way to become Debt Free faster. 3) Amazing strategies of getting out of debt, and ethically pay thousands of dollars less in interest cost of your debt Workshop No. 03 Preparing With Proper Protection You will walk out of this workshop with :- 1) The X-Curve that will reflect your familys most accurate financial situation. 2) Understanding of Proper Protection for your Family. 3) A clear picture of Asset & Liabilities your family have. Workshop No. 04 Your Health & Wealth You will walk out of this workshop with :- 1) Understanding of Importance & Impact of your health on your money. 2) The strategies to Protect your assets in case of loss of income due to sickness and disability. 3) Prepare yourself for the skyrocketing cost of medical expenses Workshop No. 05 Understanding Asset Accumulation Strategies You will walk out of this workshop with :- 1) A clear sense of accumulation of wealth & cost of waiting for the right time. 2) Discover how much returns your money can provide you if you invest in the right solutions. 3) A strategy to mitigate the risks of financial decisions and have a tension free retirement Workshop No. 06 Fulfilling Long Term Goals You will walk out of this workshop with :- 1) A plan for your Golden Years. 2) Understanding of pensions, annuities, IRAs and more, 3) Understanding of how taxes impacts your retirement money. 4) You will have plan to save for college for many generations in your family. COMPLEMENTARY PERSONAL FINANCE STRATEGY FOR EVERY ONE ATTENDING. "The single biggest difference between financial success and financial failure is how well you manage your money. To master money, you must manage money." T. HARV EKER You Must Become Financially Literate to Build Wealth. Not an option it's a necessity. BEST SUCCESS, James Richard Financial Educator/Financial Professional 504-220-3396
800085375897.description: Financial Success and Financial Independence is attainable, and doable when you position yourself to win. All you need is a winning system

974086949287.summary: Join us on Saturday, November 2, 2024, at 12:00 PM at the Tagore Center Foundation for a transformative experience that will take you on a journey of discovery and introspection. Dress Code : Comfortable and Relaxed Begin your day with registration and networking, followed by a self-guided labyrinth walk created by artist Amy Malkan , available throughout the day. Dive into the sessions with a choice between two concurrent workshops: Reclaiming the Divine Feminine: A fireside chat with world-renowned Kathak dancer Rachna Nivas and Houston's own Ekta Popat , this session will explore the intersection of dance, Tantric philosophy, and spirituality, culminating in a movement and meditative workshop. Shakti: Awakening The Womb: Join pranic healer Shilpa Agarwal for a deeply restorative session focused on healing and connecting with the divine feminine through the wisdom of the womb. Continue your journey with an insightful panel discussion on Menstrual Health , moderated by Dr. Anita Wadhwa , where experts Dr. Sejal Desai , Shilpa Agarwal , and Dr. Shetal Vohra-Gupta will dispel myths, explore the spiritual significance of menstruation, and discuss menstrual equity laws. In the afternoon, immerse yourself in Divine Ink: Readings from South Asian Voices , moderated by Krupa Parikh , where authors Saborna Roychowdhury, Dr. Shreerekha Pillai, and Gunjen Mittal will share powerful excerpts from their work, offering unique perspectives that blend tradition, culture, and contemporary themes. Later, choose either the Shakti: Awakening The Womb: with Shilpa Agarwal or the A Fireside chat with Rachna Nivas & Ekta Popat , ensuring you experience both transformative sessions. End your day with the House of Devi Art Gallery & Reception , where you can explore a vibrant South Asian art exhibit featuring works by local Houston artists Sneha Bhavsar , Sheetal Dalwadi-Otia , Amy Malkan , Ami Mehta , Manju Unnikrishnan , Anu Srivastav , and Janvi Folmsbee-Mahimtura . Founders of House of Devi, Shital and Amisha Dalwadi , are thrilled to share the debut of their streetwear collection in the exhibit " Devi's Bedroom ." This event is a journey into discovering and defining the divine feminine energy within yourself and your surroundings. We cant wait to share this experience with you! With gratitude from your Curators, Shital and Amisha Dalwadi - Founders of House of Devi Manisha Dalwadi, Dir. of Community Engagement & Wellness Sneha Bhavsar, Dir. of Artistic Programming
974086949287.description: Big Devi Energy is a transformative event dedicated to honoring and celebrating the sacred essence of the divine feminine.
974086949287.title: Big Devi Energy

1035242085947.summary: Tired of the same old marketing events? So are we. We're turning the marketing panel on its head. Brands want straight answers to hard questions from the marketing agencies they hire. So we decided to let the agencies argue it out in front of them. 8 agencies will fight in front of 5 brand referees and an audience full of even more brands and agencies. We'll only let 10 AdTech vendors in. That way you won't be swarmed. The best marketing networking event you will ever go to. The most fun marketing event you will ever attend. The most educational party you've ever been a part of...all in one amazing evening. So there is no pressure. Then we let the refs and audience (thats you) vote for a winner. Thats not boring. Thats fun.and you might learn something or find your next agency or client. Fight Referees Kellyn Smith Kenny - Global CMO, AT&T Jennifer Bridie - VP, Marketing (CMO), Southwest Airlines Big name CMO #1 Big name CMO #1 Big name CMO #1 The Fight Card Fight #1: Hot marketing topic #1 Agency CEO vs Agency CEO Fight #2: Hot marketing topic #2 Agency CEO vs Agency CEO Fight #3: Hot marketing topic #3 Agency CEO vs Agency CEO Fight #4: Hot marketing topic #4 Agency CEO vs Agency CEO Event Timeline 5:30pm - VIP Reception at The Sundown @ Granada 6:00pm - Doors Open / GA cocktail party with DJ Jason Esquire 7pm - Fights begin 8:15pm-ish - After Party on the @ The Sundown Tickets Here's how it works: Brands : FREE: 40 blocks available. 1 - VIP ticket (VIP reception, must be CMO or equiv), 4 - GA tickets, After Party access Agencies : 40 agency blocks available. There are no sponsor "speaking" opportunities for this event. There are no outside ticket sales. Agencies are required to purchase a "ticket block" or get a vendor to throw you some tickets (it happens!) There are 3 levels. Entry : $500 : 2 - GA tickets, After Party access Standard : $1,250 : 4 - GA tickets, 1 - VIP ticket (VIP reception), After Party access Premium : $2,000 : 8 - GA tickets, 2 - VIP tickets (VIP reception), After Party access Ad Tech Vendors : We have 1 Marquee, 8 Fight Corner and a bunch of revelry sponsorships available . Contact Michael Pratt mike@digitalfightclub.co to get the deets. Everyone else: This event is invite only specifically for marketing peeps. If you feel you are the exception, contact Michael Pratt mike@digitalfightclub.co . The Fight Format Opening salvo: 30s ea Rebuttal #1: 15s ea Rebuttal #2: 15s ea Rebuttal #3: 15s ea Ref's question #1: 15s ea respond & rebuttal Ref's question #2: 15s ea respond & rebuttal Note: this is the traditional fight format but we have a surpise in store this time. Come and see! After Party This event flies by and after 1 hour of fights we head to the Sundown (attached to the Granada) for the after party. The buzz and energy of the fights carries over into world class relationship building which leads to amazing business!
1035242085947.description: Brand CMOs get to watch Agency CEOs fight over pressing marketing issues. Sure beats being kissed up to in an RFP pitch!
1035242085947.title: Digital Fight Club: Marketing - 2024

954501288047.summary: Wish you were more eq uipped to deal with the daily reality TV drama called the workplace? Register for the Inaugural Emotional Intelligence Summit and learn actionable strategies to address drama in the workplace. It is estimated that six in 10 men and five in 10 women experience at least one trauma, and approximately 6% of the population will experience PTSD at some point in their lives. Trauma and distress can arise from a wide array of causes, including domestic violence, sexual assault/harassment, racism, bias, harassment, economic uncertainty, political division and more.

924669530457.summary: WHATS BEING SHARED Cutting edge solutions, science and support for putting an end to cancer with top Doctors and Cancer Conquerors from Holistic, Functional and Integrative Medicine. WHATS BEING FUNDED Cancer stem cells are notorious for resisting chemotherapy and lingering in the body, leading to cancer recurrence and metastasis. Fully funded by the 2023 conference, the breast cancer stem cell research has shown very promising results. Join us at the 2025 conference to learn more about our research discoveries and why were shifting our focus to prostate cancer stem cells. WHATS HAPPENING Education, Inspiration, Community, Networking, Presentations, Workshops, Technology, Scientific Breakthroughs, Entertainment, Fundraising and a Dress to Impress Gala Dinner.
